feature of the load-balancing service. It attempts to force subsequent " "connections to a service to be redirected to the same node as long as it is " "online." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7434(glossterm) #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7438(secondary) msgid "session storage" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7442(para) msgid "" "A horizon component that stores and tracks client session information. " "Implemented through the Django sessions framework." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7448(glossterm) #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7455(primary) msgid "shared IP address" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7452(secondary) msgid "shared" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7459(para) msgid "" "An IP address that can be assigned to a VM instance within the shared IP " "group. Public IP addresses can be shared across multiple servers for use in " "various high-availability scenarios. When an IP address is shared to another" " server, the cloud network restrictions are modified to enable each server " "to listen to and respond on that IP address. You can optionally specify that" " the target server network configuration be modified. Shared IP addresses " "can be used with many standard heartbeat facilities, such as keepalive, that" " monitor for failure and manage IP failover." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7472(glossterm) msgid "shared IP group" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7474(primary) msgid "shared IP groups" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7478(para) msgid "" "A collection of servers that can share IPs with other members of the group. " "Any server in a group can share one or more public IPs with any other server" " in the group. With the exception of the first server in a shared IP group, " "servers must be launched into shared IP groups. A server may be a member of " "only one shared IP group." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7487(glossterm) #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7489(primary) msgid "shared storage" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7493(para) msgid "" "Block storage that is simultaneously accessible by multiple clients, for " "example, NFS." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7499(glossterm) #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7501(primary) msgid "Sheepdog" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7505(para) msgid "Distributed block storage system for QEMU, supported by OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7511(glossterm) #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7514(primary) msgid "Simple Cloud Identity Management (SCIM)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7518(para) msgid "" "Specification for managing identity in the cloud, currently unsupported by " "OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7524(glossterm) #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7527(primary) msgid "Single-root I/O Virtualization (SR-IOV)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7531(para) msgid "" "A specification that, when implemented by a physical PCIe device, enables it" " to appear as multiple separate PCIe devices. This enables multiple " "virtualized guests to share direct access to the physical device, offering " "improved performance over an equivalent virtual device. Currently supported " "in OpenStack Havana and later releases." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7541(glossterm) #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7543(primary) msgid "SmokeStack" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7547(para) msgid "Runs automated tests against the core OpenStack API; written in Rails." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7553(glossterm) #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7555(primary) msgid "snapshot" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7559(para) msgid "" "A point-in-time copy of an OpenStack storage volume or image. Use storage " "volume snapshots to back up volumes. Use image snapshots to back up data, or" " as "gold" images for additional servers." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7566(glossterm) #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7573(primary) msgid "soft reboot" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7577(para) msgid "" "A controlled reboot where a VM instance is properly restarted through " "operating system commands." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7583(glossterm) #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7585(primary) msgid "SolidFire Volume Driver" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7589(para) msgid "The Block Storage driver for the SolidFire iSCSI storage appliance." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7595(glossterm) msgid "SPICE" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7597(primary) msgid "SPICE (Simple Protocol for Independent Computing Environments)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml7602(para) msgid "" "The Simple Protocol for Independent Computing Environments (SPICE) provides " "remote desktop access to guest virtual machines. subject: Revert "Add a unique canonical_rule column to each Rule in the db"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-18 15:44:27.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/db/test_db_policy_rules.py', 'congress/db/db_policy_rules.py', 'congress/api/rule_model.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/congress/commit/607c4da554500fe3c84aaf69c65b96f4b98ea2a6', 'message': 'Revert "Add a unique canonical_rule column to each Rule in the db"

This reverts commit 1cec4a6602d0cb29f9b876ce5a9133ce017d5bca.

This change fails on MySQL since it declares a column of arbitrary 
length to be Unique.  MySQL requires Unique columns to have a fixed
length.

Change-Id: I8ff58fd85bbc4adc086b9799aaf9011f1d83cd7a
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Add a unique canonical_rule column to each Rule in the db"

This reverts commit 1cec4a6602d0cb29f9b876ce5a9133ce017d5bca.

This change fails on MySQL since it declares a column of arbitrary 
length to be Unique.  MySQL requires Unique columns to have a fixed
length.

Change-Id: I8ff58fd85bbc4adc086b9799aaf9011f1d83cd7a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/46/214246/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: rule_name=d['name'])

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-15 12:22:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/bcd13dfc16ee69a146e58d52550b8d9309491751', 'message': 'Enable debug logging for gate checks

This patch enables debug logging for all OpenStack services
in the gate checks to ensure that the maximum amount of
information is available for debugging gate check failures.

commit_message:
Enable debug logging for gate checks

This patch enables debug logging for all OpenStack services
in the gate checks to ensure that the maximum amount of
information is available for debugging gate check failures.

Change-Id: Ide583fa6dc06008641bbc10b1abcaa816e662337
Closes-Bug: #1482572
(cherry picked from commit 91ac17211abc7becc8e792b98b00458e91dab535)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/38/213438/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Enable debug logging for all services to make failure debugging easier echo "debug: True" | tee -a /etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml

commit_message:
Allow Sahara native urls and runtime urls to differ for datasources

When we consider things like Manila nfs shares as datasources,
the possibility arises that the native form of a datasource url
in Sahara may not be the same as the form of the url needed at
runtime in the cluster. Allow them to differ, so that we can
still record the Sahara native url form in JobExecution objects
for accurate reference while passing the correct runtime url
in job arguments, etc.

This is a base CR that will be further built on later. In this
change, native urls and runtime urls are always identical.

Change-Id: I53f4cf11320e112ffd0c4ae93b7d1f300df86878
Partial-implements: blueprint manila-as-a-data-source

added_lines: def _construct(ctx, ds_id): source = conductor.data_source_get(ctx, ds_id) if source and source.id not in data_source_urls: url = _construct_data_source_url(source.url, job_execution.id) runtime_url = _runtime_url(url) data_source_urls[source.id] = (url, runtime_url) return source input_source = _construct(ctx, job_execution.input_id) output_source = _construct(ctx, job_execution.output_id) url = _construct_data_source_url(ds.url, job_exec_id) runtime_url = _runtime_url(url) data_source_urls[ds.id] = (url, runtime_url) return data_source_urls[ds.id][1] def _runtime_url(url): return url def to_url_dict(data_source_urls, runtime=False): idx = 1 if runtime else 0 return {id: urls[idx] for id, urls in six.iteritems(data_source_urls)}
deleted_lines: input_source = conductor.data_source_get(ctx, job_execution.input_id) if input_source and input_source.id not in data_source_urls: data_source_urls[input_source.id] = _construct_data_source_url( input_source.url, job_execution.id) output_source = conductor.data_source_get(ctx, job_execution.output_id) if output_source and output_source.id not in data_source_urls: data_source_urls[output_source.id] = _construct_data_source_url( output_source.url, job_execution.id) data_source_urls[ds.id] = _construct_data_source_url( ds.url, job_exec_id) return data_source_urls[ds.id]

commit_message:
Show helpful message when request body is not provided

Avoid showing python error when no or empty request body is provided
for creating or updating request, providing some useful information
instead.

Closes-Bug: #1468597
Closes-Bug: #1466872
Change-Id: Ie3afc7c3591b4c1338f76d00238c541a7c54bd0d

commit_message:
Remove redundant connection tests

These tests are vestiges of when connection would do module
loading.  test_module_loader covers these cases.

Change-Id: Ifd45c501a1eeaa4e966fdf56fce2cbde45f91155
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/35/214235/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_create_authenticator(self):
deleted_lines: from openstack import exceptions def test_create_authenticator_v2(self): auth_args = { 'auth_url': '0', 'username': '1', 'password': '2', } conn = connection.Connection(transport='0', auth_plugin='v2password', **auth_args) self.assertEqual('0', conn.authenticator.auth_url) self.assertEqual('1', conn.authenticator.username) self.assertEqual('2', conn.authenticator.password) def test_create_authenticator_v3(self): auth_args = { 'auth_url': '0', 'username': '1', 'password': '2', } conn = connection.Connection(transport='0', auth_plugin='v3password', **auth_args) self.assertEqual('0', conn.authenticator.auth_url) self.assertEqual('1', conn.authenticator.auth_methods[0].username) self.assertEqual('2', conn.authenticator.auth_methods[0].password) def test_create_authenticator_discoverable(self): def test_create_authenticator_no_name(self): auth_args = { 'auth_url': 'http://localhost/v2', 'username': '1', 'password': '2', } conn = connection.Connection(transport='0', **auth_args) self.assertEqual('openstack.auth.identity.discoverable', conn.authenticator.__class__.__module__) def test_create_authenticator_no_nothing(self): self.assertRaises( exceptions.AuthorizationFailure, connection.Connection, )

commit_message:
Ability to detach Keystone from controllers

Second patchset

Adds the possibility to install Keystone on
separate node (non-controllers).

Partial blueprint: detach-components-from-controllers

Change-Id: I9a509f08917c2574728d17ded740061d15e53f2d

commit_message:
Use oslo.log library instead of system logging module

Use the log module form oslo_log library instead of the system
logging module for the service.vpn.plugin module.

Related-Bug: 1481370

commit_message:
Add a unique canonical_rule column to each Rule in the db

The prior version used the policy engine to catch duplicate rules, but with
HA, there will be multiple writers to the database, so the database itself
should catch the duplciates.

This change makes the database catch duplicate rules, even if the original
rule string does not match.

Change-Id: Ic7a64676aa9732cad044f1fa666131f536f355db

subject: Revert "Add a unique canonical_rule column to each Rule in the db"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-18 15:43:14.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/db/test_db_policy_rules.py', 'congress/db/db_policy_rules.py', 'congress/api/rule_model.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/congress/commit/2d8a60b95d614db58fd85c0c34e4c490172d80d3', 'message': 'Revert "Add a unique canonical_rule column to each Rule in the db"

This reverts commit 1cec4a6602d0cb29f9b876ce5a9133ce017d5bca.

This change fails on MySQL since it declares a column of arbitrary length to be Unique.  MySQL requires Unique columns to have a fixed length.

Change-Id: Ibea09f3ba78e12660f8f96b4ab4ae4d14bf5b06a
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Add a unique canonical_rule column to each Rule in the db"

This reverts commit 1cec4a6602d0cb29f9b876ce5a9133ce017d5bca.

This change fails on MySQL since it declares a column of arbitrary length to be Unique.  MySQL requires Unique columns to have a fixed length.

Change-Id: Ibea09f3ba78e12660f8f96b4ab4ae4d14bf5b06a

commit_message:
do not create tempest.conf from .sample file

tempest.conf.sample does not exist anymore* so we need to stop relying
on this file to create the tempest.conf configuration file.

* https://github.com/openstack/tempest/commit/c8a39b488b97dd876af39567f8096f15dd36b802

This patch drops the File resource that managed tempest.conf.

Closes-Bug: #1482949
Change-Id: I7c3d20a61aa88a25f1215cccb4cb36168eab05c5

commit_message:
WSGI: make it work, and test it with acceptance

* Finalize httpd service name support in API class following
  puppet-keystone model.
* Implement unit tests.
* Implement separated acceptance tests that deploy Ceilometer API in
  WSGI.

This patch aims to finalize and validate we can deploy Ceilometer API in
WSGI with puppet-ceilometer.
Also that we can update from eventlet to WSGI (it's tested in our beaker jobs).

Closes-bug: #1481532
Change-Id: I3695acf5522457837e079c36d68a0e35dbf6b72c
(cherry picked from commit 257a60ce79f00f96239d06d84c9660f14a31bd68)

commit_message:
Move TestTransportBase out of base

TestTransportBase is referred to in a couple places, but only
used in test_transport.  This change cleans that up.

Change-Id: Ic2df1b6a1ad010de983a5a8fb57db79adc441d43

added_lines: class TestTransportBase(base.TestCase): TEST_URL = 'http://www.root.url' def assertRequestHeaderEqual(self, mocked_req, name, val): """Verify that the last request made contains a header and its value """ headers = mocked_req.last_request.headers self.assertEqual(val, headers.get(name)) def assertResponseOK(self, resp, status=200, body=None): """Verify the Response object contains expected values Tests our defaults for a successful request. """ self.assertTrue(resp.ok) self.assertEqual(status, resp.status_code) if body: self.assertEqual(body, resp.text) class TestTransport(TestTransportBase):class TestTransportDebug(TestTransportBase):class TestTransportRedirects(TestTransportBase):

commit_message:
Replace '\r' with ' ' for prettytable

Table doesn't display well when there are '\r' in prettytable data.
Fixes it by replace '\r\n' with '\n' and '\r' with ' '.

Change-Id: I1fde6d33c211e9629ee0dbeab241eeba20f7b8d5
Closes-bug: #1476929

added_lines: import six row = list(row) if (row[1] and isinstance(row[1], six.string_types) and '\r' in row[1]): row[1] = row[1].replace('\r', '') if value and isinstance(value, six.string_types) and '\r' in value: value = value.replace('\r', '')

commit_message:
Add nameservers (dns) parameters

  Implement ability to use dns servers
  for nova network deployments.

  dns1: new parameter (first dns server)
  dns2: add ability to define it (second dns server)

  Defaults to undef because these dns options are optional

Change-Id: Id26c2784178990652197aa9af3fd19d949339d58
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/88/202788/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: describe 'when creating network with nameservers' do let :params do default_params.merge( { :create_networks => true, :dns1 => '8.8.8.8', :dns2 => '8.8.4.4' } ) end it { is_expected.to contain_class('nova::network').with( :dns1 => '8.8.8.8', :dns2 => '8.8.4.4' ) } it { is_expected.to contain_nova__manage__network('nova-vm-net').with( :dns1 => '8.8.8.8', :dns2 => '8.8.4.4' ) } end

commit_message:
Fix Orchestration request parameters of stack_adopt API

1) Change the "environment" parameter to 'required=false'.
2) Change the "timeout_mins" parameter to 'required=false'.
3) Delete the "param_name-n" and "param_value-n" parameters
   because these parameters are combined into 'parameters'.

Change-Id: I6a816625c9195b75f319b64960c2c975b2a4eafe
Closes-bug: #1484431

commit_message:
Expand requirements to Kilo

This patch extends version specifications for python
depencencies in order to be able to build python-fuelclient
against both Juno and Kilo releases of OpenStack

commit_message:
Fix the log level in scheduler manage

Change the log level 'WARNING' to 'ERROR' in scheduler.manage.py.
Because if the log level is WARNING, The root cause can not be
found quickly when a new share creation fails in scheduler mode.
In other words, this log level is more suitable for 'ERROR'.

Change-Id: Ic6b5a7e84e9dd8c3381b2c3760c9dcc6d434f8ed
Closes-Bug: #1481745

commit_message:
Store volume size in bdms of image being registered

If a volume size is not provided to register_image, ec2api should anyway
store it in image bdm. Otherwise it will not be exposed in describe
image operation.

Change-Id: Ibf14ffabe77f8426fc9f35e557d1dfa34082fef1

commit_message:
Add tox generated files to .gitignore

The AUTHORS and ChangeLog files are generated by tox and if
included in the commits they result in constant merge conflicts.

As these files are only needed for documentation builds which
are done by tox and always regenerated, the files have been
excluded from commits.

Change-Id: Id8e5565e101adbb1b935d9a6806de0b9fa43d026

commit_message:
Add missing "name" request parameter to create a role

A description of a "name" request parameter of API, which creates a
role, is missing. So I add it.

For details, please see http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-identity-v3.html#createRole.

Change-Id: I0c2fa699765f4b09f29386068b1f8c25902aecf9
Closes-Bug: #1485576
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-site refs/changes/04/214204/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <!-- create a role parameter --> <!ENTITY role_nameRequestParam ' <param name="name" style="plain" type="xsd:string" xmlns="http://wadl.dev.java.net/2009/02" required="true"> <wadl:doc xmlns:wadl="http://wadl.dev.java.net/2009/02" xmlns="http://docbook.org/ns/docbook" xml:lang="EN"> <para>The role name.</para> </wadl:doc> </param>'>

RamCloud installation procedure

Added the ability to run master and coordinator on different servers.
Master/Coordinator port and IP configured in settings
stop_process function updated

commit_message:
Fix tests in test_network_configuration_validator

Two tests were failing:
* TestNetworkConfigurationValidatorProtocol.test_networks_meta_vips
* TestNetworkConfigurationValidatorProtocol.test_networks_meta_ip_range

They failed because tests expected strings in test data and ints
were provided instead.

Change-Id: I17e6ff1a8bb154038b04e32e29745e9085edb276
Closes-Bug: #1486002

through Fuel UI and Fuel CLI

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/35/209035/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Beginning with Fuel 7.0, you can define the hostnames of the slave nodes through Fuel UI or CLI. To do this, in Fuel UI click "Nodes" and then click the settings icon next to the node whose hostname you are going to define: .. image:: /_images/user_screen_shots/define-hostname01.png In the pop-up window, type in the hostname that you would like to assign to the node: .. image:: /_images/user_screen_shots/define-hostname02.png You can also set the hostname through Fuel CLI by issuing the following command: :: fuel node --node 2 --hostname test-name

jinja2 is removed from here because other jinja2 features should not be accessible with templates

fix is covered by unit test
test_add_node_with_cluster_network_template in test_node_assignment_handler.TestAssignmentHandlers

Change-Id: I15e18b55654e38c29dedc84f1d480517513f62fa
Closes-Bug: #1483309

commit_message:
replace jinja2 with python templating

replace jinja2 in
nailgun.nailgun.objects.node.Node.apply_network_template
to python templating

jinja2 was used to substitute tokenized aliases with NICs'
names in template
python Template is able to do same substitution by deriving
subclasses of Template
jinja2 is removed from here because other jinja2 features
should not be accessible with templates

fix is covered by unit test
test_add_node_with_cluster_network_template in
test_node_assignment_handler.TestAssignmentHandlers

Change-Id: I15e18b55654e38c29dedc84f1d480517513f62fa
Closes-Bug: #1483309

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Utils for templates """ from string import Template class NetworkTemplate(Template): """NetworkTemplate object provides string substitution NetworkTemplate substitutes <% key %> to value for key=value Spaces inside <%...%> block are ignored Example: template = NetworkTemplate("a: <%a%> b: <% b %>") template.safe_substitute(a='aaa', b='bbb') -> "a: aaa b: bbb" """ delimiter = '<%' pattern = r""" <%\s*(?: (?P<escaped><%\s*) | (?P<named>[_a-z][_a-z0-9]*)\s*%> | (?P<braced>[_a-z][_a-z0-9]*)\s*%> | (?P<invalid>) ) """

commit_message:
Adding job_update api call

Adding ability to update jobs (only name and description
at this moment) in order to change their public/protected
attributes later.

APIImpact

PATCH /v1.1/{tenant_id}/jobs/{job_id}

Partially implements: blueprint api-for-objects-update

Change-Id: I94ffdd3fdf8844db39832194f460cbc084f5ef5c

subject: Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/feature/qos' into merge-branch
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-12 19:52:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/69152a7104cf608fa72653a8110651dcfaacec99', 'message': "Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/feature/qos' into merge-branch

This merge commit introduces QoS feature into Liberty release of
Neutron.

The feature is documented in: doc/source/devref/quality_of_service.rst
included with the merge patch.

It includes:

- QoS API service plugin with QoS policy and QoS bandwidth limit
  (egress) rule support;
- core plugin mechanism to determine supported rule types, with its ML2
  implementation;
- new agent extension manager;
- QoS agent extension with pluggable backend QoS drivers (Open vSwitch
  and SR-IOV support is included).

To extend network and port core resources with qos_policy_id attribute,
a new ML2 extension driver (qos) was introduced that relies on the QoS
core resource extension (the idea is that eventually we'll get a core
resource extension manager that can be directly reused by core plugins).

Agent-server interaction is based on:

- get_device_details() API that is extended with qos_policy_id;
- a new push/pull mechanism that allows agents and servers to
  communicate using oslo.versionedobjects based objects sent on the
  wire.

The merge includes the following types of test coverage:

- unit tests;
- functional tests for OVS agent, QoS agent extension, and low level
  ovs_lib changes;
- API tests to cover port/network qos_policy_id attribute and new QoS
  resources.

The client changes can be found at:

* https://review.openstack.org/189655
* https://review.openstack.org/198277

The team also prepared fullstack test but it needs to wait for client
merge before it can pass in the gate:

* https://review.openstack.org/202492

Gerrit does not show diff for merge changes that did not result in any
conflict, so to facilitate review, rely on the following steps:

- fetch the patch locally
- git fetch origin
- git diff origin/master...

Partially-Implements: blueprint quantum-qos-api
Partially-Implements: blueprint ml2-qos
Partially-Implements: blueprint ml2-qos-ovs-bwlimiting
Partially-Implements: blueprint ml2-sriov-qos-with-bwlimiting
Change-Id: I92916d0e391791187e9a25ff172fb4b3504857b1
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-12 19:53:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ccea8406a2a69279ce053f9aa76863aaca039e58', 'message': "Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/feature/qos' into merge-branch

This merge commit introduces QoS feature into Liberty release of
Neutron.

The feature is documented in: doc/source/devref/quality_of_service.rst
included with the merge patch.

It includes:

- QoS API service plugin with QoS policy and QoS bandwidth limit
  (egress) rule support;
- core plugin mechanism to determine supported rule types, with its ML2
  implementation;
- new agent extension manager;
- QoS agent extension with pluggable backend QoS drivers (Open vSwitch
  and SR-IOV support is included).

To extend network and port core resources with qos_policy_id attribute,
a new ML2 extension driver (qos) was introduced that relies on the QoS
core resource extension (the idea is that eventually we'll get a core
resource extension manager that can be directly reused by core plugins).

Agent-server interaction is based on:

- get_device_details() API that is extended with qos_policy_id;
- a new push/pull mechanism that allows agents and servers to
  communicate using oslo.versionedobjects based objects sent on the
  wire.

The merge includes the following types of test coverage:

- unit tests;
- functional tests for OVS agent, QoS agent extension, and low level
  ovs_lib changes;
- API tests to cover port/network qos_policy_id attribute and new QoS
  resources.

The client changes can be found at:

* https://review.openstack.org/189655
* https://review.openstack.org/198277

The team also prepared fullstack test but it needs to wait for client
merge before it can pass in the gate:

* https://review.openstack.org/202492

Gerrit does not show diff for merge changes that did not result in any
conflict, so to facilitate review, rely on the following steps:

- fetch the patch locally
- git fetch origin
- git diff origin/master...

This merge commit introduces QoS feature into Liberty release of
Neutron.

The feature is documented in: doc/source/devref/quality_of_service.rst

It includes:

- QoS API service plugin with QoS policy and QoS bandwidth limit
  (egress) rule support;
- core plugin mechanism to determine supported rule types, with its ML2
  implementation;
- new agent extension manager;
- QoS agent extension with pluggable backend QoS drivers (Open vSwitch
  and SR-IOV support is included).

a new ML2 extension driver (qos) was introduced that relies on the QoS
core resource extension (the idea is that eventually we'll get a core
resource extension manager that can be directly reused by core plugins).

Agent-server interaction is based on:

- get_device_details() API that is extended with qos_policy_id;
- a new push/pull mechanism that allows agents and servers to
  communicate using oslo.versionedobjects based objects sent on the
  wire.

The merge includes the following types of test coverage:

- unit tests;
- functional tests for OVS agent, QoS agent extension, and low level
  ovs_lib changes;
- API tests to cover port/network qos_policy_id attribute and new QoS
  resources.

* https://review.openstack.org/189655
* https://review.openstack.org/198277

The team also prepared fullstack test but it needs to wait for client
merge before it can pass in the gate:

* https://review.openstack.org/202492

Gerrit does not show diff for merge changes that did not result in any
conflict, so to facilitate review, rely on the following steps:

- fetch the patch locally
- git fetch origin
- git diff origin/master...

commit_message:
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/feature/qos' into merge-branch

Note to reviewers: gerrit diff for merge patches is very limited, and
leaving comments in global section won't scale, so please comment here:

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qos-merge-back-review

This merge commit introduces QoS feature into Liberty release of
Neutron.

The feature is documented in: doc/source/devref/quality_of_service.rst
included with the merge patch.

It includes:

- QoS API service plugin with QoS policy and QoS bandwidth limit
  (egress) rule support;
- core plugin mechanism to determine supported rule types, with its ML2
  implementation;
- new agent extension manager;
- QoS agent extension with pluggable backend QoS drivers (Open vSwitch
  and SR-IOV support is included).

To extend network and port core resources with qos_policy_id attribute,
a new ML2 extension driver (qos) was introduced that relies on the QoS
core resource extension (the idea is that eventually we'll get a core
resource extension manager that can be directly reused by core plugins).

Agent-server interaction is based on:

- get_device_details() method that is extended with qos_policy_id;
- a new push/pull mechanism that allows agents and servers to
  communicate using oslo.versionedobjects based objects sent on the
  wire.

The merge includes the following types of test coverage:

- unit tests;
- functional tests for OVS agent, QoS agent extension, and low level
  ovs_lib changes;
- API tests to cover port/network qos_policy_id attribute and new QoS
  resources.

The client changes can be found at:

* https://review.openstack.org/189655
* https://review.openstack.org/198277

The team also prepared fullstack test but it needs to wait for client
merge before it can pass in the gate:

* https://review.openstack.org/202492

Gerrit does not show diff for merge changes that did not result in any
conflict, so to facilitate review, rely on the following steps:

- fetch the patch locally
- git fetch origin
- git diff origin/master...

This merge also disables qos extension API tests until the service is
enabled in master gate.

Local changes apart from conflicts:
- updated down_revision for qos migration to reflect master expand head;
- disabled qos API tests with gate_hook.sh until we have it enabled in
  master gate;
- bumped oslo.versionedobjects requirement to reflect what is in
  openstack/requirements' global-requirements.txt

DocImpact
APIImpact
Partially-Implements: blueprint quantum-qos-api
Partially-Implements: blueprint ml2-qos
Partially-Implements: blueprint ml2-qos-ovs-bwlimiting
Partially-Implements: blueprint ml2-sriov-qos-with-bwlimiting
Change-Id: I92916d0e391791187e9a25ff172fb4b3504857b1

commit_message:
Change redstack to only install server plugin

Using the Trove devstack plugin was dependent on having a
python-troveclient plugin also 'enabled.' This has been changed
so that there is no need to separately enable a client plugin.
The code to do so has therefore been removed.

Variables have been added/modified to control how the plugin
is installed, and how the client is installed within the plugin.

Change-Id: Ic984dab5acc75934c5e9de19ac8bc4e2a6c4049a
Depends-On: If5a76360249827c19759a5c90dc00f70c59c32cc

commit_message:
Add Admin interface bonding option

Add adming interface bonding option to
the userguide and note that it does not
support LACP.

commit_message:
Fuel 7.0 UI changes

Update the Fuel 7.0 UX workflow and add
the dashboard tab. This commit focuses on the dashboard changes,
and the Nodes tab with sorting, filtering, and adding custom labels.
We are not changing the entire userguide with this commit.
Other commits will follow to change the rest.

Change-Id: I016222109971c42029e434b4917f0f8a18d92cae

commit_message:
Disable tempest swift tests when DEPLOY_SWIFT=no

Currently, if you do not deploy swift you will get a tempest failure
when running the swift tests. This patch adds
'tempest_service_available_swift: False' to user_variables.yml when
DEPLOY_SWIFT=no.

Closes-Bug: #1485945
Change-Id: I2aba46171263a7a54716d3ecbb0e6dc68e840d93
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/02/214102/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: else echo "tempest_service_available_swift: False" | tee -a /etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml

commit_message:
Generate ids in environment-apps-edit command

This commit adds helper function, that traverses resulting object-model
before sending it to API and replaces any occurances of ===id1===,
===id2===, etc. with generated uuids.
Helper function keeps track of already generated ids.

Targets blueprint: env-configuration-from-cli

Change-Id: Iea20a2601a5dc4b8f92c3e935074ac2d7828d005
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-muranoclient refs/changes/36/213136/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NOTE: Values '===id1===', '===id2===', etc. in the resulting object-model will be substituted with uuids. object_model = jpatch.apply(environment.services) utils.traverse_and_replace(object_model)

commit_message:
Possibility to set values lower than min size for Disk Volumes

   - appropriate validation added
   - also fixed Disk Error state:
          situation when there is too small disk size for the assigned roles

Closes-Bug: #1484938

commit_message:
Make redirect type configurable

This change exposes a redirect type configuration variable so that a
user can specify if they want to use 'temp' or 'permanent' redirects.

This change allows a user to switch to use a 'temp' redirect type
because Mozilla Firefox and Google Chrome cache the responses of '301
Moved Permanently'. Some users have multi tenant environments that have
different URLs for Horizon dashboards (Ubuntu - /horizon, CentOS -
dashboard). '302 Found' is not cacheable response which solves the issue
for multitenant users.

Change-Id: I81694d0ddeebafec7824f5b275d5fb504cd302b1
Closes-Bug: 1385133
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Fix docs about using SupportStatus during remove

Fix docs about using SupportStatus for object after
deprecation period. Also, fix several typos and
format mistakes.

Change-Id: I4d26f9977859ff845d7ff561cdd64180f5b848c4
Closes-bug: #1484868
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/65/213065/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: team, i.e. user can use it, but it may be broken. but should be defined or changed any time SupportStatus is specified or Any additional information about object's state, e.g. ``'Use property new_property instead.'``. helpful for displaying full life cycle of object. Type of *previous_status*This section describes life cycle of such objects as resource, property and attribute. All these objects have same life cycle:: UNSUPPORTED -> SUPPORTED -> DEPRECATED -> HIDDEN \ -> UNSUPPORTED where UNSUPPORTED are optional.to *previous_status* and add to *version* current release as value. If some new*support_status* status should equals to HIDDEN. HIDDEN status means hiding object from documentation and from result of :code:`resource-type-list` CLI command, if object is resource. Also, :code:`resource-type-show` command with such resource will raise `NotSupported` exception.
deleted_lines: - PROTOTYPE. Prototype of object. Not supported at current time. team, i.e. user can use it, but it may be broken. Not used at current time. but should be defined or changes any time SupportStatus is specified or Any additional information about object's state, e.g. 'Use property new_property instead.'. helpful for displaying full life cycle of object. Type of `previous_status`This section described life cycle of such objects as resource, property and attribute. All these objects have same life cycle: PROTOTYPE -> SUPPORTED -> DEPRECATED -> HIDDEN \ -> UNSUPPORTED where PROTOTYPE and UNSUPPORTED are optional.to *previous_status* and add to version current release as value. If some new*support_status* status should equals to HIDDEN. All using of hidden object in new stacks is prohibited, but old stacks continue running. So if template uses removed object, StackValidationFailed exception will raised.

GlusterFS backup driver

This patch introduces GlusterFS storage as a backup target.
GlusterFS backup driver inherits from Posix backup driver[1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/163647/

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Tests for Backup NFS driver. """ import os import mock from oslo_config import cfg from cinder.backup.drivers import glusterfs from cinder.brick.remotefs import remotefs as remotefs_brick from cinder import context from cinder import exception from cinder import test from cinder import utils CONF = cfg.CONF FAKE_BACKUP_MOUNT_POINT_BASE = '/fake/mount-point-base' FAKE_HOST = 'fake_host' FAKE_EXPORT_PATH = 'fake/export/path' FAKE_BACKUP_SHARE = '%s:/%s' % (FAKE_HOST, FAKE_EXPORT_PATH) FAKE_BACKUP_PATH = os.path.join(FAKE_BACKUP_MOUNT_POINT_BASE, FAKE_EXPORT_PATH) class BackupGlusterfsShareTestCase(test.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(BackupGlusterfsShareTestCase, self).setUp() self.ctxt = context.get_admin_context() def test_check_configuration_no_backup_share(self): self.override_config('glusterfs_backup_share', None) self.mock_object(glusterfs.GlusterfsBackupDriver, '_init_backup_repo_path', mock.Mock(return_value=FAKE_BACKUP_PATH)) with mock.patch.object(glusterfs.GlusterfsBackupDriver, '_check_configuration'): driver = glusterfs.GlusterfsBackupDriver(self.ctxt) self.assertRaises(exception.ConfigNotFound, driver._check_configuration) def test_init_backup_repo_path(self): self.override_config('glusterfs_backup_share', FAKE_BACKUP_SHARE) self.override_config('glusterfs_backup_mount_point', FAKE_BACKUP_MOUNT_POINT_BASE) mock_remotefsclient = mock.Mock() mock_remotefsclient.get_mount_point = mock.Mock( return_value=FAKE_BACKUP_PATH) self.mock_object(glusterfs.GlusterfsBackupDriver, '_check_configuration') self.mock_object(remotefs_brick, 'RemoteFsClient', mock.Mock(return_value=mock_remotefsclient)) self.mock_object(utils, 'get_root_helper') with mock.patch.object(glusterfs.GlusterfsBackupDriver, '_init_backup_repo_path'): driver = glusterfs.GlusterfsBackupDriver(self.ctxt) path = driver._init_backup_repo_path() self.assertEqual(FAKE_BACKUP_PATH, path) utils.get_root_helper.called_once() mock_remotefsclient.mount.assert_called_once_with(FAKE_BACKUP_SHARE) mock_remotefsclient.get_mount_point.assert_called_once_with( FAKE_BACKUP_SHARE)

commit_message:
Don't use context.elevated to get volume

Original Problem:
=================
Since the metadata(readonly and attached_mode) is stored in admin metadata,
normal user need `run context.elevated` to retrieves admin metadata.
The above way will bring a side effect. Normal user can also get
any volume which the user shouldn't access when the user knows the UUID.

Solution:
=========
Use context instead of context.elevated to get volume.
And add admin metadata to it.
Based on cinder-meetup-summer-2015 conclusion, we use the solution.
The solution will need extra database connection.

Change-Id: I06f21e7578b65a59c0fe4d3afe0e882ed73c4725
Closes-Bug: #1477625
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/50/206450/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # volume.get should just get the volume in the project. # But because of context.elevated, it's possible to get # the volume in project. We should exclude it. if (rv['project_id'] != context.project_id and not context.is_admin): raise exception.VolumeNotFound(volume_id=volume_id)

commit_message:
Improve time synchronization for fuel-devops

Use ntp.py logic from fuel-qa for synchronize the time on nodes
in the current environment

Change-Id: Id5f0247ee158d5d97f819a462995756ffa8dafd4
Closes-Bug:#1483804

commit_message:
Split Jenkins job names by distro name when it possible

To get full test group name from Jenkins job names like
'7.0.system_test.ubuntu.services_ha.ceilometer', let's split the
job names by distro name if it is in the job name.

Change-Id: I19a23a69b29d62f9c12641e68756caea2c7f538f
Closes-Bug:#1485308

commit_message:
Bind to IP in arping if requested IP already assigend

Arping can't detect duplicates if there is a second
activated interface on the same LAN. It can be worked
around by binding to the requested IP address when
trying to detect duplicates.

Change-Id: I3d47b85ddd1a8894e6a2526e1a42e9cbd0b4de52
Closes-Bug: #1463418

commit_message:
Addding spec for Objects update support in Sahara API

Current Sahara API doesn't support update of some objects,
which can be required by some other features.

Updates are already implemented for node group templates,
cluster templates, job binaries and data sources and should
be done for clusters, jobs, job executions and job binary
internals.

APIImpact

PATCH /v1.1/{tenant_id}/jobs/{job_id}
PATCH /v1.1/{tenant_id}/clusters/{cluster_id}
PATCH /v1.1/{tenant_id}/job-executions/{job_execution_id}
PATCH /v1.1/{tenant_id}/job-binary-internals/{job_binary_internal_id}

Change-Id: I591ffa587083ca94bbe402b8ba333f4a9a1b6b0e
blueprint: api-for-objects-update
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-specs refs/changes/78/208378/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================== Objects update support in Sahara API ==================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/sahara/+spec/api-for-objects-update This specification proposes to add api calls that allows to update objects that currently cant be updated this way. Problem description =================== Current Sahara API doesn't support update of some objects, which can be required by some other features (for example it's needed for shared and protected resources implementation that will be proposed in ACL spec later). Updates are already implemented for node group templates, cluster templates, job binaries and data sources and should be done for clusters, jobs and job executions. Proposed change =============== Update operation will be added for cluster, job and job execution objects. For clusters and jobs only description update will be allowed for now. There is nothing will be allowed to update for job executions, just an API call and corresponding methods will be added. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- Following API calls will be added: **PUT /v1.1/{tenant_id}/clusters/{cluster_id}/update** **PUT /v1.1/{tenant_id}/jobs/{job_id}** **PUT /v1.1/{tenant_id}/job-executions/{job_execution_id}​** Other end user impact --------------------- This update methods will be added to saharaclient API. Deployer impact --------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Sahara-image-elements impact ---------------------------- None Sahara-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- This update methods will not be added to Horizon yet, but will be added later as part of ACL spec. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: apavlov-n Work Items ---------- * Adding new API calls; * Adding operations to saharaclient; * Documentation update in api-ref. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit tests will be added. Documentation Impact ==================== Sahara REST API documentation if api-ref will be updated. References ========== None

The guestagent related settings are in the database section of the
taskmanager.conf.sample file.  If a user were to use this sample then
the guestagent related settings will not be read by the taskmanager
service because it expects these guestagent related settings to be
in the default section.  This fix moves the guestagent related
settings to the default section.

Change-Id: I8dbdf7abcfd5f2341831cc6daaf5cb14d8d42d61

(cherry picked from commit 9b47609941d338da11e29d79f4a74e6b3bdd6e3b)

commit_message:
Move guestagent settings to default section

The guestagent related settings are in the database section of the
taskmanager.conf.sample file.  If a user were to use this sample then
the guestagent related settings will not be read by the taskmanager
service because it expects these guestagent related settings to be
in the default section.  This fix moves the guestagent related
settings to the default section.

Change-Id: I8dbdf7abcfd5f2341831cc6daaf5cb14d8d42d61
Closes-Bug: #1459415
(cherry picked from commit 9b47609941d338da11e29d79f4a74e6b3bdd6e3b)

commit_message:
acceptance: enable debug & verbosity for OpenStack logs

Enable debug & verbose when possible for OpenStack services logs, so we can read a maximum
of informations in Jenkins jobs logs and easily debug our eventual failures.

Change-Id: If0830b591138c5c6742c06d09eab6e85a9b0bcb1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ironic refs/changes/08/213508/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
acceptance: enable debug & verbosity for OpenStack logs

Enable debug & verbose when possible for OpenStack services logs, so we can read a maximum
of informations in Jenkins jobs logs and easily debug our eventual failures.

Change-Id: I2d71b91a4f4d2e36d6c5f5d60b0a5ceea71bcf13

commit_message:
Make exit checks more simple

Change-Id: I84adffb8643192d2c12b233a00d7b2f6dff681ea
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/65/213365/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: RESULT=$?if [ $RESULT -ne 2 ]; then exit $RESULT# Run a second time to ensure nothing changes. set +e sudo puppet apply $PUPPET_ARGS --modulepath=modules:.modules modules/openstack_integration/manifests/testing/scenario001.pp RESULT=$? set -e if [ $RESULT -ne 0 ]; then exit $RESULT
deleted_lines: FIRST_RUN_RC=$? sudo puppet apply $PUPPET_ARGS --modulepath=modules:.modules modules/openstack_integration/manifests/testing/scenario001.pp SECOND_RUN_RC=$?if [ $FIRST_RUN_RC -ne 2 ] && [ $FIRST_RUN_RC -ne 0 ]; then echo "First Puppet apply failed with ${FIRST_RUN_RC} return code." exit 1 elif [ $FIRST_RUN_RC -eq 0 ]; then echo "First Puppet apply successfully without any change." exit $FIRST_RUN_RC elif [ $FIRST_RUN_RC -eq 2 ]; then echo "First Puppet apply ran successfully with changes." exit $FIRST_RUN_RCif [ $SECOND_RUN_RC -ne 0 ]; then if [ $SECOND_RUN_RC -eq 2 ]; then echo "Second Puppet apply ran successfully with changes, so manifests are not idempotent." else echo "Second Puppet apply failed with ${SECOND_RUN_RC} return code." fi exit 1 else echo "Second Puppet apply ran successfully without any change." exit $SECOND_RUN_RC

commit_message:
Selectable offloading modes

Add information on how to enable/disable
selectable offloading modes through Fuel CLI/UI

Closes-Bug:#1476644
Change-Id: Idca06077778da6702b223b05444b9e2d8e186856
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/92/207892/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. raw:: pdf PageBreak .. _selectable-offload: Select offloading modes ----------------------- You can select offloading modes for physical interfaces starting with Fuel 7.0. The number of possible offloading types depends on the interfaces' hardware. Fuel automatically detects the offloading modes for any given physical interface, which you can edit through Fuel UI or Fuel CLI. Editing the offloading modes through Fuel CLI +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ #. On the Fuel Master node, dump the interfaces information using this :ref:`fuel CLI<fuel-cli-config>` command:: fuel node --node 1 --network --download where ``--node 1`` points to the specific node (id=1 in this example). #. Edit the ``root/node_1/interfaces.yaml`` file to enable, disable, or leave the default value next to the ``state`` field: * true - value for enabled offloading modes * false - value for disabled offloading modes * null - value for default offloading modes #. Upload the modified file: :: fuel node --node 1 --network --upload Editing the offloading modes through Fuel UI ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ In the Fuel UI click the "Nodes" tab, select a node, and click "Configure Interfaces": .. image:: /_images/user_screen_shots/ui_select_offloads01.png On the "Configure interfaces" screen, click "Offloading Modes" Default": .. image:: /_images/user_screen_shots/ui_select_offloads02.png Edit the offloading types and click "Apply".

commit_message:
Fix random fails test_validate_networks_not_in_db

In error message that was checked in tests, order of IDs
might differ between tests run. Now error message is
checked by regex and ids are compared without taking
order into account.

Change-Id: I358e9689742d3ea387c7e3765387394554b38cfc
Closes-Bug: #1485953

commit_message:
Metadefs Upgrade By JSON File

Currently, metadata definitions may be added, but, not upgraded
by a JSON file. This blueprint defines a new process for allowing
metadata definitions to be upgraded with a JSON file.

Change-Id: Ifff0c85d8ad36839cd2adab0cb34157e808ecfe6
Implements: blueprint metadefs-upgrade-by-json-file
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/15/158015/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =============================================== Software Metadata Definitions - Upgrade Options =============================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/metadata-definitions-upgrade-options The spec will provide a basis for upgrading metadata-definitions from a supplied JSON file. Problem description =================== Currently, to add a new metadata-definition namespace you would run: glance-manage db load_metadefs [/${directory}; default=/etc/glance/metadefs/] All .JSON files under the directory specification will be used as input. If the Namespace found in a JSON file already exists in the database the contents are ignored, otherwise, the Namespace will be added. You can also add a new Namespace via the Horizon Metadata Definitions UI or the glance command line utility (CLI). While you can upgrade a Namespace via the glance CLI, there is currently no way to upgrade a Namespace with a supplied JSON file. Proposed change =============== Supply a new glance-manage db merge_metadefs command. The full specification would be: glance-manage db merge_metadefs [--file JSON-file | --path folder-with-JSON-files] {--overwrite | --prefer-existing (default) | --prefer-new} with choices in [] as mandatory and those in {} as optional Merge option flags: --overwrite Would overwrite an existing Namespace. --prefer-existing If the same Property or Object exists, prefer existing. (default) Any Properties, Objects and Tags that exist, but, are not in the JSON file, will be left alone. New JSON Properties, Objects and Tags will be added. Existing Namespace details will remain untouched. --prefer-new If the same Property or Object exists, prefer new. Any Properties, Objects and Tags that exist, but, are not in the JSON file will be left alone. New JSON Properties, Objects and Tags will be added. Existing Namespace details will be modified. Note: This is the same behaviour as --overwrite except for how the existing, but, not new Properties, Objects and Tags are treated (i.e., they will be preserved). If the Namespace is not found, merge_metadefs should: report an error? add the new Namespace? Alternatives ------------ 1. Could overload the glance-manage db load_metadefs command. We could keep the --path choice while adding the --file JSON-file option and the merge options listed above. 2. The --prefer-new option tag is of debatable worth as it is only different from --overwrite on how it treats the "existing, but, not new Properties, Objects and Tags" (i.e., it leaves them in place). If this is not deemed critical, then we may not implement the --prefer-new option. 3. The ability to update an existing Namespace via a JSON file may be added to the python-glanceclient tool, either alternatively or in conjunction with adding to glance-manage. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- No, impacts glance-manage and/or glance client. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: pawel-koniszewski Other contributors: pawel-koniszewski Reviewers --------- Core reviewer(s): nikhil-komawar <launchpad-id or None> Other reviewer(s): wayne-okuma Work Items ---------- Provide definition files for different categories of software. - Databases - Web servers - Runtime environments - More Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Test cases involving the new tag options will need to be added. Documentation Impact ==================== Update documents with the new upgrade options. References ========== http://docs.openstack.org/developer/glance/metadefs-concepts.html

commit_message:
Provide a way to upgrade metadata definitions

Currently there is no way to upgrade metadata definitions to the
newest set. This change extends existing command:
glance-manage db load_metadefs.

The extension allows user to merge metadata definitions that are
stored in files with data that exists in database. By default it
prefers existing data over new (--merge), but it can be combined
with other options to change this logic. Use --prefer_new flag so
it will prefer new data over existing data in database or
--overwrite so it will drop every namespace (and attached
resources) found in both, database and file.

By default glance-manage db load_metadefs works the same way it
worked before extension. To enable new logic user needs to
provide at least --merge option (or combine it with other two
options)

Implements: blueprint metadefs-upgrade-by-json-file
Change-Id: I55fa6640142db5110deb88d9ecd8507e7f533c58
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/32/159532/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six @args('--path', metavar='<path>', help='Path to the directory where ' 'json metadata files are stored.') @args('--file', metavar='<file>', help='Json file that contains metadata.') @args('--prefer_new', action='store_true', help='Prefer new metadata over existing. Existing metadata ' 'might be overwritten.') def merge_metadefs(self, path=None, file=None, prefer_new=False): """Read metadefinition file or path and merge with data in database""" prefer_existing = not prefer_new metadata.db_merge_metadefs(db_api.get_engine(), path, file, prefer_existing) def merge_metadefs(self, path=None, file=None, prefer_existing=None): self.command_object.merge_metadefs(path, file, prefer_existing) parser = subparsers.add_parser('db_merge_metadefs') parser.set_defaults(action_fn=legacy_command_object.merge_metadefs) parser.add_argument('path', nargs='?') parser.add_argument('file', nargs='?') parser.add_argument('prefer_new', nargs='?') parser.set_defaults(action='db_merge_metadefs') if isinstance(v, six.string_types): v = encodeutils.safe_decode(v) func_kwargs[k] = v

commit_message:
fix rally scenarios

1. ec2_servers has been commited to rally and our ec2_server object
now conflicts with rally`s. in this patchset our object has been renamed.

2. rally now doesn't save context between runs. it passes original context
to each run. before this feature we stored something in context and
didn't count first run. moved to using global var of ec2 plugin.
rally was changed here - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/203911/9

3. added route tables preparation for floating ip associating.

4. Scenarios was refactored in rally
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/212831/3

Change-Id: I57d6298a8ae734720f68a0caf2b36c92f32893b0

commit_message:
Adjust core network roles to sync with manifests

remove "mgmt/api" network role

fix tests for "ceph/public" network role
it has "management" as default_mapping

Change-Id: Id6c87de91d3bb63b2906d4df64ecea364a2c519b
Closes-Bug: #1484560

commit_message:
Catch v3 keystone unauthorized error when creating stack

If v3 keystone unauthorized error raise during creating stack,
then this stack will remaid in status of create_in_progress. This
patch modify heat keystoneclient to catch unauthorized error and
set stack status to failed.

Closes-Bug: #1376213
Change-Id: I9a34c20fc6ac3ce235aaba4eac25a6d5ceb43f5f

commit_message:
Set the node_id param as a required property

The node_id property is a required property to perform the re-assigning
a node with a given ID from one cluster to another.

Change-Id: I2442442260f19833db239b01856d0ff4f63ecfbb
Closes-Bug: #1483239

commit_message:
[Manila] Add share networks context for existing users

Add context for share networks that will be used in case of usage deployment
with existing users. Provided share networks via context option
"share_networks" will be balanced between all share creations of scenarios.

Change-Id: Ibdd55c3a41659b5b0eb634787bad29a9f7b83b55
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/23/185423/34 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Mirantis Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import itertools from oslo_config import cfg from rally.benchmark.context import base from rally.benchmark import utils as bench_utils from rally.common.i18n import _ from rally.common import log from rally.common import utils from rally import consts from rally import exceptions from rally import osclients from rally.plugins.openstack.scenarios.manila import utils as manila_utils CONF = cfg.CONF LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) @base.context(name="manila", order=450) class Manila(base.Context): """This context creates resources specific for Manila project.""" CONFIG_SCHEMA = { "type": "object", "$schema": consts.JSON_SCHEMA, "properties": { # NOTE(vponomaryov): specifies whether manila should use # share networks for share creation or not. "use_share_networks": {"type": "boolean"}, # NOTE(vponomaryov): if context arg 'share_networks' has values # then they will be used else share networks will be autocreated - # one for each tenant network. If networks do not exist then will # be created one share network for each tenant without network # data. This context arg will be used only when context arg # "use_share_networks" is set to True and context 'existing_users' # is not empty, considering usage of existing users. # Expected value is list of dicts where tenant Name or ID is key # and list of share_network Names or IDs is value. Example: # share_networks = [ # {"tenant_1_name_or_id": ["share_network_1_name_or_id", # "share_network_2_name_or_id"]}, # {"tenant_2_name_or_id": ["share_network_3_name_or_id"]} # ] # Also, make sure that all 'existing users' in appropriate # registered deployment have share networks if its usage is # enbaled, else Rally will randomly take users that does not # satisfy criteria. "share_networks": {"type": "object"}, # NOTE(vponomaryov): following settings will be used only if share # networks are used and autocreated. "use_security_services": {"type": "boolean"}, # NOTE(vponomaryov): context arg 'security_services' is expected # to be list of dicts with data for creation of security services. # Example: # security_services = [ # {'type': 'LDAP', 'dns_ip': 'foo_ip', 'server': 'bar_ip', # 'domain': 'quuz_domain', 'user': 'ololo', # 'password': 'fake_password', 'name': 'optional_name'} # ] # Where 'type' is required key and should have one of following # values: 'active_directory', 'kerberos' or 'ldap'. "security_services": {"type": "array"}, }, "additionalProperties": False } DEFAULT_CONFIG = { "use_share_networks": True, "share_networks": [], "use_security_services": False, "security_services": [], } def _setup_for_existing_users(self): if (self.config["use_share_networks"] and not self.config["share_networks"]): msg = _("Usage of share networks was enabled but for deployment " "with existing users share networks also should be " "specified via arg 'share_networks'") raise exceptions.ContextSetupFailure( ctx_name=self.get_name(), msg=msg) for tenant_name_or_id, share_networks in self.config[ "share_networks"].items(): # Verify project existence for tenant in self.context["tenants"].values(): if tenant_name_or_id in (tenant["id"], tenant["name"]): tenant_id = tenant["id"] endpoint = None for user in self.context["users"]: if user["tenant_id"] == tenant_id: endpoint = user["endpoint"] break break else: msg = _("Provided tenant Name or ID '%s' was not found in " "existing tenants.") % tenant_name_or_id raise exceptions.ContextSetupFailure( ctx_name=self.get_name(), msg=msg) self.context["tenants"][tenant_id]["share_networks"] = [] clients = osclients.Clients(endpoint) manila = manila_utils.ManilaScenario(clients=clients) existing_sns = manila._list_share_networks( detailed=False, search_opts={"project_id": tenant_id}) for sn_name_or_id in share_networks: # Verify share network existence for sn in existing_sns: if sn_name_or_id in (sn.id, sn.name): break else: msg = _("Specified share network '%(sn)s' does not " "exist for tenant '%(t)s'") % { "sn": sn_name_or_id, "t": tenant_id} raise exceptions.ContextSetupFailure( ctx_name=self.get_name(), msg=msg) # Set share network for project self.context["tenants"][tenant_id][ "share_networks"].append(sn) # Add generator over share networks for each project self.context["tenants"][tenant_id]["sn_iterator"] = ( itertools.cycle( self.context["tenants"][tenant_id]["share_networks"])) # Set flag that says we will not delete/cleanup share networks self.context["manila_delete_share_networks"] = False def _setup_for_autocreated_users(self): # Create share network for each network of tenant for user, tenant_id in (utils.iterate_per_tenants( self.context.get("users", []))): networks = self.context["tenants"][tenant_id].get("networks") clients = osclients.Clients(user["endpoint"]) manila = manila_utils.ManilaScenario(clients=clients) self.context["tenants"][tenant_id]["share_networks"] = [] self.context["tenants"][tenant_id]["security_services"] = [] data = {"name": manila._generate_random_name( prefix="rally_manila_share_network_")} def _setup_share_network(tenant_id, data): share_network = manila._create_share_network(**data) self.context["tenants"][tenant_id][ "share_networks"].append(share_network) if self.config["use_security_services"]: for ss in self.config["security_services"]: security_service = manila._create_security_service( **ss) self.context["tenants"][tenant_id][ "security_services"].append(security_service) manila._add_security_service_to_share_network( share_network.id, security_service.id) if networks: for network in networks: if network.get("cidr"): data["nova_net_id"] = network["id"] elif network.get("subnets"): data["neutron_net_id"] = network["id"] data["neutron_subnet_id"] = network["subnets"][0] else: LOG.warning(_( "Can not determine network service provider. " "Share network will have no data.")) _setup_share_network(tenant_id, data) else: _setup_share_network(tenant_id, data) # NOTE(vponomaryov): create one infinite iterator over # share networks per tenant. It allows us to balance our shares # among share networks. self.context["tenants"][tenant_id]["sn_iterator"] = ( itertools.cycle( self.context["tenants"][tenant_id]["share_networks"])) @utils.log_task_wrapper(LOG.info, _("Enter context: `manila`")) def setup(self): if not self.config["use_share_networks"]: return elif self.context["config"].get("existing_users"): self._setup_for_existing_users() else: self._setup_for_autocreated_users() @utils.log_task_wrapper(LOG.info, _("Exit context: `manila`")) def cleanup(self): if not self.context.get("manila_delete_share_networks", True): # NOTE(vponomaryov): assume that share networks were not created # by test run return for user, tenant_id in (utils.iterate_per_tenants( self.context.get("users", []))): clients = osclients.Clients(user["endpoint"]) manila = manila_utils.ManilaScenario(clients=clients) objects = [ {"list": self.context["tenants"][tenant_id][ "share_networks"] or [], "name": "share network", "delete_func": manila._delete_share_network}, {"list": self.context["tenants"][tenant_id][ "security_services"] or [], "name": "security service", "delete_func": manila._delete_security_service}, ] for obj_set in objects: for obj in obj_set["list"]: logger = log.ExceptionLogger( LOG, _("Failed to delete %(name)s %(id)s for tenant " "%(t)s.") % {"id": obj, "t": tenant_id, "name": obj_set["name"]}) with logger: obj_set["delete_func"](obj) # NOTE(vponomaryov): Share network deletion schedules deletion of # share servers. So, we should wait for its deletion too to avoid # further failures of network resources release. # Use separate cycle to make share servers be deleted in parallel. for user, tenant_id in (utils.iterate_per_tenants( self.context.get("users", []))): clients = osclients.Clients(self.context["admin"]["endpoint"]) manila = manila_utils.ManilaScenario(clients=clients) for sn in self.context["tenants"][tenant_id]["share_networks"]: share_servers = manila._list_share_servers( search_opts={"share_network": sn.id}) for share_server in share_servers: bench_utils.wait_for_delete( share_server, update_resource=bench_utils.get_from_manager(), timeout=CONF.benchmark.manila_share_delete_timeout, check_interval=( CONF.benchmark.manila_share_delete_poll_interval))

commit_message:
Pin heat and neutron

Pinning both heat and neutron to a version from Aug 7th when our
CI jobs worked. I think a combination of regressions in both of
these is causing our CI to fail.

We don't currently have logs to open an informed bug as logs
arn't being retrieved from the overcloud nodes we only know that
the overcloud stack is timing out.

Change-Id: If5852d8e4e942aaa0a2ed87cef983b8ece2aad4b

commit_message:
Disallow set node label with empty key CLI v2

Label's key can not be empty string, so need to handle this case and raise error

Change-Id: I23919d26f29246dd392ae44738cc79579b64507a
Closes-Bug: #1484099

added_lines: if not key: msg = 'Wrong label "{}" was provided. Label key couldn\'t ' \ 'be an empty string.'.format(label) raise error.ArgumentException(msg)

'}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2015-08-10 17:29:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/58ade28d762683a30bf47ad6203e0ee9f87154fc', 'message': "3PAR: Adding performance metrics for load balanced provisioning

For load balanced virtual volume provisioning, it is necessary to have 
access to real time performance metrics (IO/s, KB/s, IO/B, and service time)
from a 3PAR array. This data is available from the 3PAR CLI, but currently 
there's no way to use the 3PAR CPG performance data in the filter/goodness 
function used by the evaluator/scheduler for load balancing volume 
placement among multiple 3PAR backends. 

In cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_common.py, adds a call to
getCPGStatData, which calls the srstatld CLI command for performance 
metrics depending on the appropriate client API version, and uses the 
output to populate new fields in the output of get_volume_stats. 

In cinder/tests/unit/test_hp3par.py, adds unit tests in
TestHP3PARFCDriver.test_get_volume_stats and in
TestHP3PARISCSIDriver.test_get_volume_stats. Also fixes assertEqual calls so
that they comply with the convention assertEqual(expected, actual).

Closes-bug: #1482741

Change-Id: If9e7b5ffd100489af6537f7dab970d89a6d70851
"}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2015-08-10 19:34:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/4e4f3f3b85d8e2fca8f67e4811e8a8bce68b9881', 'message': "3PAR: Adding performance metrics for load balanced volume placement

metrics depending on the appropriate client API version, and uses the
output to populate new fields in the output of get_volume_stats.

"}, {'number': 13, 'created': '2015-08-10 22:44:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/87454337f746ba4d540681174e7cc5a45c36cfd9', 'message': '3PAR: Adding performance metrics for load balancing volume placement

If one storage backend has high load while another has lower load, when a
user/admin creates a volume, the current evaluator/scheduler may place the
volume on the backend with higher load. Instead the evaluator/scheduler should
always place that volume on the backend with the lowest load for load balancing
purposes. In general, for load balancing virtual volume placement, an
evaluator/scheduler needs access to real time performance metrics (e.g.
throughput, bandwidth, latency, IO size) which Cinder does not have currently.

These performance metrics are available from the 3PAR CLI, but they are
currently inaccesible in the evaluator/scheduler. The proposed changes make it
possible to define filter and goodness functions in /etc/cinder/cinder.conf
which include 3PAR CPG performance metrics. Note that the filter and goodness
functions are used by the evaluator/scheduler to evaluate where to place a
new volume among multiple 3PAR backends. Thus, the proposed changes give the
evaluator/scheduler access to the real time performance metrics necessary
for load balancing volume placement.

In cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_common.py, uses the 3PAR client method
HP3parClient.getCPGStatData to get performance metrics, and adds new fields in
the output of HP3ParClient.get_volume_stats corresponding to the performance
metrics: throughput, bandwidth, latency, io_size, queue_length, and
avg_busy_perc.

In cinder/tests/unit/test_hp3par.py, adds unit tests in
TestHP3PARFCDriver.test_get_volume_stats and in
TestHP3PARISCSIDriver.test_get_volume_stats. Also fixes assertEqual calls so
that they comply with the convention assertEqual(expected, actual).

Closes-bug: #1482741

Change-Id: If9e7b5ffd100489af6537f7dab970d89a6d70851

commit_message:
3PAR: Adding performance metrics to volume status

If one storage backend has high load while another has lower load,
when a user/admin creates a volume, the current evaluator/scheduler
may place the volume on the backend with higher load. In many cases,
the evaluator/scheduler should place that volume on the backend
with the lowest load for load balancing purposes. In general, for load
balancing virtual volume placement, an evaluator/scheduler needs
access to performance metrics (e.g. IOPS throughput, bandwidth,
latency, IO size) to measure load, but Cinder drivers don't generally
report those metrics.

Although these performance metrics are available from the 3PAR CLI,
they are currently inaccesible in the evaluator/scheduler. The
proposed changes add these metrics to the volume status report and
thus make them accesible by the evaluator/scheduler.

In cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_common.py, uses the 3PAR
client method HP3parClient.getCPGStatData to get performance metrics,
and adds new fields in the output of HP3PARCommon.get_volume_stats
corresponding to the performance metrics: IOPS throughput, bandwidth,
latency, io_size, queue_length, and avg_busy_perc. These metrics are
taken by averaging samples taken once per day for the last week.

In cinder/tests/unit/test_hp3par.py, adds unit tests in
TestHP3PARFCDriver.test_get_volume_stats and in
TestHP3PARISCSIDriver.test_get_volume_stats.

Closes-bug: #1482741

commit_message:
Validate name and description string

If you pass name or description parameters with more than 255
characters to create and update apis of volume and snapshot
and create api of backup, then it returns 500 error code.

Added new method validate_name_and_description() in
cinder.api.openstack.wsgi.Controllera to validate string limit and
returned 400 if limit exceeds and also removing leading or trailing
whitespaces and string containing only whitespaces.

APIImpact
1. For all above APIs 400 response will be returned.
2. Earlier it was possible to pass only whitespaces or leading-trailing
   spaces to 'name' parameter.
   Now it will raise 400 error if only whitespaces are passed and will
   remove leading-trailing spaces if present in other cases.

Closes-Bug: 1454244
Change-Id: Iaf7159e816f69fd776a09828c3bc1d27fc9fdcdb

added_lines: def test_volume_create_with_name_too_long(self): vol = { "size": '1', "name": 'a' * 256, } body = {"volume": vol} req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('/v2/volumes') self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidInput, self.controller.create, req, body) def test_volume_create_with_description_too_long(self): vol = { "size": '1', "description": 'a' * 256, } body = {"volume": vol} req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('/v2/volumes') self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidInput, self.controller.create, req, body) def test_volume_create_with_name_as_integer(self): vol = { "size": '1', "name": 1234, } body = {"volume": vol} req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('/v2/volumes') self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidInput, self.controller.create, req, body) def test_volume_create_with_description_as_integer(self): vol = { "size": '1', "description": 1234, } body = {"volume": vol} req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('/v2/volumes') self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidInput, self.controller.create, req, body) def test_update_volume_with_name_too_long(self): updates = { "name": 'a' * 256, "description": "Updated Test Description", } body = {"volume": updates} req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('/v2/volumes/1') self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidInput, self.controller.update, req, 1, body) def test_update_volume_with_description_too_long(self): updates = { "name": "Updated Volume Name", "description": 'a' * 256, } body = {"volume": updates} req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('/v2/volumes/1') self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidInput, self.controller.update, req, 1, body) def test_update_volume_with_name_as_integer(self): updates = { "name": 1234, "description": "Updated Test Description", } body = {"volume": updates} req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('/v2/volumes/1') self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidInput, self.controller.update, req, 1, body) def test_update_volume_with_description_as_integer(self): updates = { "name": "Updated Volume Name", "description": 1234, } body = {"volume": updates} req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('/v2/volumes/1') self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidInput, self.controller.update, req, 1, body)

commit_message:
Bump hacking version

global requirements as of stable/kilo list

hacking>=0.10.0,<0.11

but Ironic stable/kilo still uses <0.10.

Manually bump the hacking version and fix arising violations.

Change-Id: I99d0c18ec773b2e72d3a9e83a1d4ff8d49d1ca6a

commit_message:
ml2: Fix typo with ml2_srvio/supported_pci_vendor_devs param.

This commit just fix the typo with supported_pci_vendor_devs param.

Please see:
http://docs.openstack.org/kilo/config-reference/content/networking-plugin-ml2_sriov.html

Closes-Bug: #1482322
Change-Id: I90ccb0b94d4b3cfbe5d6e16f107227a1756e745b

subject: Enable cinder-manage to remove services
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-01 14:43:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/ebbc49c48ca5474884b755aa40561afeb05b9a52', 'message': 'Enable cinder-manage to delete old services from the database

These changes are to enable cinder-manage to remove old services
from the database like nova does. All that is being added is the remove
method to manage.py and a test to cover this new method in test_cmd.py.

To use this new command, the user types cinder-manage remove
<host> <service> and the service will be removed.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I3bcec824d3c5f65fdd187459428025993a2010a0
Implements-blueprint: add-cinder-service-removal

commit_message:
Enable cinder-manage to remove services

These changes are to enable cinder-manage to remove old services
from the database like nova does. All that is being added is the remove
method to manage.py and tests to cover this new method in test_cmd.py.
The command will remove the binary from the list of running services
in the db that can be viewed via "cinder-manage service list". NOTE:
Active and restarted services will re-populate the DB with their current
status automatically.

To use this new command, the user types "cinder-manage service remove
<binary> <host>" and the service will be removed.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I3bcec824d3c5f65fdd187459428025993a2010a0
Implements-blueprint: add-cinder-service-removal

commit_message:
Enable ceilometer in devstack

Magnum is going to send metrics/notifications to ceilometer. The
metrics will be leveraged to trigger ceilometer alarms, which is
needed to achieve autoscaling bay.

Change-Id: Ib80c9ab699a72701cefc4dfeb7f2542cecd8f2c9
Partially-Implements: blueprint autoscale-bay
Partially-Implements: blueprint magnum-notifications
