commit_message:
Switch from deprecated timeutils.isotime

oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime() is deprecated as of 1.6 so we need
to stop using it.

This patch replaces timeutils.isotime(dt) with dt.isoformat() as
the deprecation message suggests in oslo_utils.timeutils.
However this might be a backward incompatible change as
timeutils.isotime() produced '1955-11-05T18:00:00Z' format
but datetime.isoformat() produces '1955-11-05T18:00:00+00:00'
format.

Change-Id: Ied2643d3d891600e0e5cd31c7ef1ff6107e3a777
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects refs/changes/63/211063/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return value.isoformat() return value.isoformat()

commit_message:
Add spec for security-group-logging

blueprint security-group-logging
Change-Id: I34622f8d16ea3d5de1a673ed0c96d84013be4793
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/34/132134/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Security-group Logging ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/security-group-logging Adding security-group logging. * Security-group doesn't log at all today, but it's necessary for both users and developers. 1. Users need logs to make sure their security-group rule works as expected, and to assess what kinds of packets went through their security-group or were dropped. 2. Developers need logs for trouble shooting. Problem Description =================== Security-group doesn't log at all today, but it's necessary for both users and developers. 1. Users need logs to make sure their security-group rule works as expected, and to assess what kinds of packets went through their security-group or were dropped. 2. Developers need logs for trouble shooting. Proposed Change =============== * Add security-group logging that outputs log data into syslog. * The logging feature is disabled by default, and it can be enabled by something like this (needs to be discussed) * [CLI] neutron security-group-rule-update <uuid> --enable_logging=true * [API] PUT /v2.0/security-group-rules/<uuid> (followed by a body part) * The following data are candidates to be logged. (those data can be obtained from iptables [1]) :IN: input device :OUT: output device :MAC: MAC address(destination MAC:source MAC) :SRC: source IP address :DST: destination IP address :LEN: IP packet size :TOS: the value of IP header TOS field :PREC: the value of PRECEDENCE in IP header TOS field :TTL: the value of IP header TTL :ID: the value of IP header ID :DF: IP header Flag DF bits(Don't Fragment is true) :PROTO: protocol(TCP, UDP) :SPT: source port number :DPT: destination port number :LEN: (in case of UDP) UDP header size Data Model Impact ----------------- None REST API Impact --------------- None Security Impact --------------- None Notifications Impact -------------------- None Other End User Impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ * Current design is to log data into syslog, but considering to log data into memory (e.g. cyclic buffer) to minimize performance overhead Other Deployer Impact --------------------- None Developer Impact ---------------- None Community Impact ---------------- None Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: y-furukawa-2 Other contributors: shiina-hironori Work Items ---------- * Finalize data to be logged * Finalize a way to log data (syslog vs cyclic buffer) * Implement Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit Test Tempest Tests ------------- API test(security-group) Functional Tests ---------------- * Regression test with the logging feature enabled API Tests --------- security-group API test Documentation Impact ==================== None User Documentation ------------------ None Developer Documentation ----------------------- * Write how to enable the security-group logging * Write description of each field of log data References ========== * [1] net/ipv4/netfilter/ipt_LOG.c

added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== FWaaS Logging ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/fwaas-logging Adding FWaaS logging. * FWaaS doesn't log at all today, but it's necessary for both users and developers. 1. Users need logs to make sure their Firewall rule works as expected, and to assess what kinds of packets went through their router or were dropped. 2. Developers need logs for trouble shooting. Problem Description =================== * FWaaS doesn't log at all today, but it's necessary for both users and developers. 1. Users need logs to make sure their Firewall rule works as expected, and to assess what kinds of packets went through their router or were dropped. 2. Developers need logs for trouble shooting. Proposed Change =============== * Adding FWaaS logging that outputs log data into syslog * The logging feature is disabled by default, and it can be enabled by something like this (needs to be discussed) * [CLI] neutron firewall-rule-update --enable_logging=true <uuid> * [API] PUT /v2.0/fw/firewall_rules/<uuid> (followed by a body part) * The following data are candidates to be logged. (those data can be obtained from iptables [1]) :IN: input device :OUT: output device :MAC: MACaddress(destination MAC:source MAC) :SRC: source IP address :DST: destination IP address :LEN: IP packet size :TOS: the value of IP header TOS field :PREC: the value of PRECEDENCE in IP header TOS field :TTL: the value of IP header TTL :ID: the value of IP header ID :DF: IP header Flag DF bits(Don't Fragment is true) :PROTO: protocol(TCP, UDP) :SPT: source port number :DPT: destination port number :LEN: (in case of UDP) UDP header size Data Model Impact ----------------- None REST API Impact --------------- None Security Impact --------------- None Notifications Impact -------------------- None Other End User Impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ * Current design is to log data into syslog, but considering to log data into memory (e.g. cyclic buffer) to minimize performance overhead Other Deployer Impact --------------------- None Developer Impact ---------------- None Community Impact ---------------- None Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: y-furukawa-2 Other contributors: shiina-hironori Work Items ---------- * Finalize data to be logged * Finalize a way to log data (syslog vs cyclic buffer) * Implement Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit Test Tempest Tests ------------- FWaaS API test Functional Tests ---------------- * Regression test with logging API Tests --------- FWaaS API test Documentation Impact ==================== None User Documentation ------------------ None Developer Documentation ----------------------- * Write how to enable the fwaas logging * Write description of each field of log data References ========== * [1] net/ipv4/netfilter/ipt_LOG.c

chapter. Correct typos.

subject: Endpoints without API version and refactored auth
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-13 13:16:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/c40b133efd02e77a7e9ddc46b32f84319a51d1d2', 'message': "Public endpoint without API version

The public endpoint (and internal when derived from it) can support both API
versions 2.0 and 3. To do so the URL must not be suffixed with the version.

Although the keystone documentation doesn't reflect it yet, this has been
confirmed by Keystone developers and as a matter of fact works. Effectively,
Keystone will automatically adjust to either versions depending on the context.

For instance, using the default values will create the following catalog:
keystone identity RegionOne
  publicURL: http://127.0.0.1:5000
  internalURL: http://127.0.0.1:5000
  adminURL: http://127.0.0.1:35357/v2.0

Change-Id: Id94967df9e507fa62d6f135a4470d07564f5ba8f

commit_message:
Endpoints without API version and refactored auth

1. Purely cosmetic change on keystone provider
Reorders methods in alphabetical order for better readability and anticipating
coming changes.

2. Admin endpoint is used to build os-url as fail back when they're no others
URL available for authenticating. This is typically the case when bootstrapping,
where no users/roles are available yet. Refactoring those methods brings better
readability, troubleshooting and to help maintain it.
- Refactors the 'get' endpoints methods
- Makes sure the API version is present when using the service_url (os-url) for
user password validation

3. All endpoints support API versions 2.0 and 3 without specifying the version.
Per keystone documentation [1]. Although the main Openstack wiki pages might not
reflect this entirely. Effectively, Keystone automatically adjusts to either
versions depending on the context.

For instance, using the default values will create the following catalog:
keystone identity RegionOne
  publicURL: http://127.0.0.1:5000
  internalURL: http://127.0.0.1:5000
  adminURL: http://127.0.0.1:35357

For easier and faster validation, this review has been broken down into smaller
pieces. It will allow 1. and 2. to be back-ported to Kilo:
1. https://review.openstack.org/213598
2. https://review.openstack.org/213603
3. https://review.openstack.org/213957

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/doc/source/http-api.rst

Change-Id: Id94967df9e507fa62d6f135a4470d07564f5ba8f

commit_message:
Combine multiple YAMLs into single YAML

This commit combines the contents of the
three YAML files (for Glance, Heat and
Murano assets) into a single file
called assets.yaml. It also modifies
the javascript for the website so the
site will load the assets.yaml file
instead of the three individual YAML
files.

Change-Id: Ia004e6d4f3b51ca853945b136abdc1599d7af4b8
Implements: blueprint expand-asset-types

subject: Implement a yaml formatter in cliff
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-05 04:17:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cliff/commit/fbe2b306e83e36ae0c72404919b8a6e8abe14c40', 'message': "Implement a yaml formatter in cliff

This change replaces the cliff-tablib yaml formatter with an internal
replacement. It differs from the tablib formatter in the following ways:
- always outputs with block formatting rather than the PyYAML default
  of deciding based on value content
- emit_one serialises a simple dict where the column name is the key
  and the data item is the value (rather than a list of dicts with
  'Field' and 'Value' keys)

The cliff release which contains this change will need a corresponding
cliff-tablib release which removes the yaml formatter from its setup.py
entry_points.

Change-Id: I691dbab3dee7c5ec28b1083f87ab1f5c051d582b
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-06 04:48:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cliff/commit/fd3e3ece4c61b471266fbfbb59e3311fc3db6e32', 'message': "Implement a yaml formatter in cliff

This change replaces the cliff-tablib yaml formatter with an internal
replacement. It differs from the tablib formatter in the following ways:

  of deciding based on value content
- emit_one serialises a simple dict where the column name is the key
  and the data item is the value (rather than a list of dicts with
  'Field' and 'Value' keys)
- emit_one preserves column order by printing a single-item dict for
  each column_name

The cliff release which contains this change will need a corresponding
cliff-tablib release which removes the yaml formatter from its setup.py

commit_message:
Implement a yaml formatter in cliff

This change replaces the cliff-tablib yaml formatter with an internal
replacement. It differs from the tablib formatter in the following ways:
- always outputs with block formatting rather than the PyYAML default
  of deciding based on value content
- emit_one serialises a simple dict where the column name is the key
  and the data item is the value (rather than a list of dicts with
  'Field' and 'Value' keys)
- emit_one preserves column order by printing a single-item dict for
  each column_name

The cliff release which contains this change will need a corresponding
cliff-tablib release which removes the yaml formatter from its setup.py
entry_points.

Change-Id: I691dbab3dee7c5ec28b1083f87ab1f5c051d582b
Related-Bug: #1308744

added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python from six import StringIO import yaml from cliff.formatters import yaml_format import mock def test_yaml_format_one(): sf = yaml_format.YAMLFormatter() c = ('a', 'b', 'c', 'd') d = ('A', 'B', 'C', '"escape me"') expected = { 'a': 'A', 'b': 'B', 'c': 'C', 'd': '"escape me"' } output = StringIO() args = mock.Mock() sf.emit_one(c, d, output, args) actual = yaml.safe_load(output.getvalue()) assert expected == actual def test_yaml_format_list(): sf = yaml_format.YAMLFormatter() c = ('a', 'b', 'c') d = ( ('A1', 'B1', 'C1'), ('A2', 'B2', 'C2'), ('A3', 'B3', 'C3') ) expected = [ {'a': 'A1', 'b': 'B1', 'c': 'C1'}, {'a': 'A2', 'b': 'B2', 'c': 'C2'}, {'a': 'A3', 'b': 'B3', 'c': 'C3'} ] output = StringIO() args = mock.Mock() sf.add_argument_group(args) sf.emit_list(c, d, output, args) actual = yaml.safe_load(output.getvalue()) assert expected == actual

commit_message:
Support time-delays in server.resize

Resize operation in nova(that we are for flavor update) is
asynchronous. So the server may be ACTIVE when we are checking
server-resize operations(not RESIZE as was excepted).
We need to wait for a while till the server becomes RESIZE.

The patch add support of this case to Server resource in heat.
Closes-bug: #1471135

Conflicts:
	heat/tests/test_instance.py
	heat/tests/test_server.py
(cherry-picked from commit f46af8a8e2daa52f6485d65da4ad69db6f0a32bd)

Change-Id: I19914081996104c5f2144a6de795173f26774c21

added_lines: def fail_status(server): server.status = 'ERROR' return_server.get = fail_status.__get__(return_server) "Error: Resizing to 'm1.small' failed, status 'ERROR'", def test_server_update_flavor_resize_has_not_started(self): """Test update of server flavour if server resize has not started. Server resize is asynchronous operation in nova. So when heat is requesting resize and polling the server then the server may still be in ACTIVE state. So we need to wait some amount of time till the server status becomes RESIZE. """ # create the server for resizing server = self.fc.servers.list()[1] server.id = '1234' server_resource = self._create_test_server(server, 'resize_server') # prepare template with resized server update_template = copy.deepcopy(server_resource.t) update_template['Properties']['flavor'] = 'm1.small' self.m.StubOutWithMock(self.fc.servers, 'get') self.fc.servers.get('1234').AndReturn(server) # define status transition when server resize # ACTIVE(initial) -> ACTIVE -> RESIZE -> VERIFY_RESIZE def active_status(srv): srv.status = 'ACTIVE' server.get = active_status.__get__(server) def resize_status(srv): srv.status = 'RESIZE' server.get = resize_status.__get__(server) def verify_resize_status(srv): srv.status = 'VERIFY_RESIZE' server.get = verify_resize_status.__get__(server) self.m.StubOutWithMock(self.fc.client, 'post_servers_1234_action') self.fc.client.post_servers_1234_action( body={'resize': {'flavorRef': 2}}).AndReturn((202, None)) self.fc.client.post_servers_1234_action( body={'confirmResize': None}).AndReturn((202, None)) self.m.ReplayAll() # check that server resize has finished correctly scheduler.TaskRunner(server_resource.update, update_template)() self.assertEqual((server_resource.UPDATE, server_resource.COMPLETE), server_resource.state) self.m.VerifyAll()

commit_message:
Add base_attributes_schema to documentation

Currently base_attributes_schema omitted in docs,
so there's no chance to learn about base attributes.
This patch adds base_attributes_schema to docs and
fixes description of "show" base attribute.

Change-Id: Id382e39401d368367f1813e7f9e4508d4dffef72
Closes-bug: #1484142

commit_message:
Remove test for job type in get_data_sources

There is an explicit test for job type in get_data_sources() with
an early return, but for all job_executons input_id and
output_id will be set to None on creation if they are not present
and data_source_get() will return None when the id is None. So, the
explicit test is not needed -- remove for easier maintenance.

Change-Id: I36f59d9fdb3cde923d09e17af346cff8b518eb8e

commit_message:
Add pyinotify to global-requirements.txt

This module is needed for oslo.log library.

Is the library actively maintained? -Yes.
https://github.com/seb-m/pyinotify/commits/master.
Is the library good code? -Yes.
Is the library python 3 compatible? -Yes.
Is the library license compatible? -Yes. It uses MIT license.
Is the library already packaged in the distros we target? -No.
Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
in ``global-requirements.txt``? -No.


License of lib is MIT. It is Python 3 compatible.

Change-Id: Ia7eafdc31438c625716adfcdd17d6af72a361919

commit_message:
go: replicator rewrite

The replicator no longer uses HTTP, really.  It uses HTTP to set up a
TCP connection, then does a simple json protocol over it for replication.

We're just tired of fighting with go's Expect: 100-continue handling.

See doc.go for details on the protocol.

Change-Id: I007beadc7c1682cca91f6bc389c1319713cc6f04
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/96/211296/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: package objectserver import ( "bufio" "encoding/binary" "encoding/json" "fmt" "net" "net/http" "net/http/httputil" "time" ) var RepUnmountedError = fmt.Errorf("Device unmounted") var repDialer = (&net.Dialer{Timeout: 5 * time.Second, KeepAlive: 30 * time.Second}).Dial const repIoTimeout = time.Minute * 10 type BeginReplicationRequest struct { Device string Partition string NeedHashes bool } type BeginReplicationResponse struct { Hashes map[string]string } type SyncFileRequest struct { Path string Xattrs string Size int64 } type SyncFileResponse struct { Exists bool NewerExists bool GoAhead bool Msg string } type FileUploadResponse struct { Success bool Msg string } type RepConn struct { rw *bufio.ReadWriter c net.Conn Disconnected bool } func (r *RepConn) SendMessage(v interface{}) error { r.c.SetDeadline(time.Now().Add(repIoTimeout)) jsoned, err := json.Marshal(v) if err != nil { r.Close() return err } if err := binary.Write(r.rw, binary.BigEndian, uint32(len(jsoned))); err != nil { r.Close() return err } if _, err := r.rw.Write(jsoned); err != nil { r.Close() return err } if err := r.rw.Flush(); err != nil { r.Close() return err } return nil } func (r *RepConn) RecvMessage(v interface{}) (err error) { r.c.SetDeadline(time.Now().Add(repIoTimeout)) var length uint32 if err = binary.Read(r.rw, binary.BigEndian, &length); err != nil { r.Close() return } data := make([]byte, length) if _, err = r.rw.Read(data); err != nil { r.Close() return } if err = json.Unmarshal(data, v); err != nil { r.Close() return } return } func (r *RepConn) Write(data []byte) (l int, err error) { r.c.SetDeadline(time.Now().Add(repIoTimeout)) if l, err = r.rw.Write(data); err != nil { r.Close() } return } func (r *RepConn) Flush() (err error) { r.c.SetDeadline(time.Now().Add(repIoTimeout)) if err = r.rw.Flush(); err != nil { r.Close() } return } func (r *RepConn) Read(data []byte) (l int, err error) { r.c.SetDeadline(time.Now().Add(repIoTimeout)) if l, err = r.rw.Read(data); err != nil { r.Close() } return } func (r *RepConn) Close() { r.Disconnected = true r.c.Close() } func NewRepConn(ip string, port int, device string, partition string) (*RepConn, error) { url := fmt.Sprintf("http://%s:%d/%s/%s", ip, port, device, partition) req, err := http.NewRequest("REPCONN", url, nil) if err != nil { return nil, err } conn, err := repDialer("tcp", req.URL.Host) if err != nil { return nil, err } hc := httputil.NewClientConn(conn, nil) resp, err := hc.Do(req) if err != nil { return nil, err } if resp.StatusCode/100 != 2 { return nil, RepUnmountedError } newc, _ := hc.Hijack() return &RepConn{rw: bufio.NewReadWriter(bufio.NewReader(newc), bufio.NewWriter(newc)), c: newc}, nil }

commit_message:
Time synchronization check in recon.

This change add call time to recon middleware and param --time to
recon CLI. This is usefull for checking if time in cluster is
synchronized.

Change-Id: I62373e681f64d0bd71f4aeb287953dd3b2ea5662

commit_message:
Add dashboard folder and graphite dashboard to doc

Create a dashboard folder to hold HTML files that provide
dashboard views into various parts of neutron.  This allows
the dashboards to be "living code" rather than frozen in
amber via shortened URLs.

The first dashboard example is a simple HTML file that
shows thumbnails of graphite plots of all neutron jobs
in the check pipeline.  Clicking a thumbnail brings up
the larger graphite plot page.

Change-Id: I47e7718c2aae41c8308fd331377984e47a892294
Signed-off-by: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/41/213141/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Do not require the token_id for converting v3 to v2 tokens

Requiring the token_id as part of the arguments for converting v3 to
v2 tokens results in a more difficult transition to the unification
of the code paths for issuing and validating V2 tokens. This is the
first step in eliminating similar but not-quite the same code paths
for issuing and validating Fernet V2 tokens and all other forms of
V2 tokens.

Change-Id: I348974c8285a1a7b724aee1bfbf2d694d5d77406

commit_message:
Maintain the expiry of v2 fernet tokens

The v2 fernet provider didn't carry the expiration of a token from it's
parent token when handling a rescope. This means that a rescope of fernet
tokens could extend the session indefinitely.

Change-Id: Id1ec725fd89cd32260b7be4eead24a0fc84abfe1
closes-bug: #1469563

commit_message:
Add copyright to the initial commit of iRMC deploy driver code.

This patch adds copyright notice to the initial commit [1] of iRMC
deploy driver source code in accordance with "APPENDIX: How to
apply the Apache License to your work" [2].
Also this is a reflection of the gerrit review comments in [3] that is
there's no problem adding a copyright line in the license header in
OpenStack, and in [4] that is there is a minimum consensus of initial
commit copyright notice.

[1] commit f55ab34e54cffd10b263db6d74e2669e75de6e4b
[2] http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/171672/
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/212973/

Change-Id: I1a3c2cdbf3aa2c6b4d16a12f6ef6b7bf1dbb983e

commit_message:
tests: Do not skip IPv6 tests

Namely:
    test_router_update_gateway_upon_subnet_create_ipv6
    test_router_update_gateway_upon_subnet_create_max_ips_ipv6

They no longer need to be skipped after the recently merged
neutron change. [1]

They have been skipped by overriding with no-op methods
in our class.  This commit un-skip them by removing the
overrides.

commit_message:
Add copyright to the initial commit of iRMC power driver code.

This patch adds copyright notice to the initial commit [1] of iRMC
power driver source code in accordance with "APPENDIX: How to apply
the Apache License to your work" [2].
Also this is a reflection of the gerrit review comments in [3] that is
there's no problem adding a copyright line in the license header in
OpenStack, and in [4] that is there is a minimum consensus of initial
commit copyright notice.

[1] commit 4412b83481343304f2f1bc5c4da4b65d8dc1a9ed
[2] http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/171672/
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/212973/

Change-Id: Iec6ab4128f33f4eecc730626172f2e2d06eb0a2c

commit_message:
Add image tag specification in dev-quickstart.md

Now starting kolla by using command: sudo ./tools/kolla-compose start.

It will raise an exception like:
"compose.progress_stream.StreamOutputError: Tag latest not found in
repository docker.io/kollaglue/centos-rdo-rabbitmq".

We should let user know to change tag in yaml file according the tags in
hub.docker.com

Change-Id: I30bed869ae5da0825b201bc3c0a49d8c1496e87d
Closes-Bug: #1485521

commit_message:
Updated master for new dev work - 15 Aug 2015

This patch updates all git SHA's to the current head of
the appropriate branches.

This patch includes the upstream fix for CVE-2015-5163:
 - https://review.openstack.org/212567

This patch removes the configuration for the cryptography
repository as they have now released tag 1.0 which contains
the SHA we required for fernet tokens to work.

Change-Id: Iaab3a9d1007ccae6d51942fe045e274b7a518e9f
Closes-Bug: #1484766

commit_message:
Remove compose from documenation

Receive several quickstart related questions every day.  Make a
first pass at cleaning up our documentation to point people
in the right direction.  While we are about it remove compose
related bits.  Anything in the compose directory will remain as
a reference implementation for how to implement the compose
files to work well with our container content.

Change-Id: I9e832e97ac2bacca8eab7e1bfbd82664d2b191b8
Closes-Bug: #1485163
Paritally-Implements: blueprint remove-config-internal

added_lines: To install Kolla depenedencies use:1.7.0 or later.The basic starting environment will be created using `ansible`.inventory file.Configure Ansible by reading the Kolla Ansible configuration documentation [DEPLOY][]. [DEPLOY]: https://github.com/stackforge/kolla/blob/master/docs/ansible-deployment.md $ sudo ./tools/kolla-ansible deploy A bare metal system takes three minutes sto deploy AIO. A virtual machine takes five minutes to deploy AIO. $ sudo docker ps -a $ sudo docker logs <container-id>
deleted_lines: In order to run Kolla, it is mandatory to run a version of `docker-compose` that includes pid: host support. Support was added in version 1.3.0 and is specified in the requirements.txt. To install this and other potential future dependencies:1.6.0 or later. Docker 1.5.0 has a defect in `--pid=host` support where the libvirt container cannot be stopped and crashes nova-compute on start.The basic starting environment will be created using `docker-compose`.compose directory.To start, setup your environment variables. $ cd kolla $ ./tools/genenv The `genenv` script will create a compose/openstack.env file and an openrc file in your current directory. The openstack.env file contains all of your initialized environment variables, which you can edit for a different setup. A mandatory step is customizing the FLAT_INTERFACE network interface environment variable. The variable defaults to eth1. In some cases, the second interface in a system may not be eth1, but a unique name. For example with an Intel driver, the interface is enp1s0. The interface name can be determined by executing the ifconfig tool. The second interface must be a real interface, not a virtual interface. Make certain to store the interface name in `compose/openstack.env`: NEUTRON_FLAT_NETWORK_INTERFACE=enp1s0 FLAT_INTERFACE=enp1s0 $ sudo ./tools/kolla-compose start Finally, run the status command: $ sudo ./tools/kolla-compose status This will display information about all Kolla containers.All Docker commands should be run from the directory of the Docker binary, by default this is `/`. The `start` command to Kolla is responsible for starting the containers using `docker-compose -f <service-container> up -d`. If you want to start a container set by hand use this template: $ docker-compose -f glance-api-registry.yml up -d $ sudo ./docker ps -a $ sudo ./docker logs <container-id> $ docker-compose logs <container-id> If you want to start a individual service like `glance-api` manually, use this template. This is a good method to test and troubleshoot an individual container. Note some containers require special options. Reference the compose yml specification for more details: $ sudo ./docker run --name glance-api -d \ --net=host \ --env-file=compose/openstack.env \ kollaglue/fedora-rdo-glance-api:latest

subject: Validate string, integer limit for input parameter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-24 07:25:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/77aa2c5af61aea1da10f7242f3db0e80ab01b0e6', 'message': "Validate string, integer limit for input parameter

1. If you pass name or description parameters with more than
   255 characters to the below apis, then it returns
   500 error code.
   a. consisgroup-create
   b. consisgroup-update
   c. cgsnapshot-create
   d. quota-class-update
   e. quota-update
   f. qos-create

2. If you pass 'hard_limit' value above mysql INT type to below
   apis, then it returns 500 error code.
   a. quota-class-update
   b. quota-update

3. Below apis accept string with whitespaces,
   a. consisgroup-create
   b. cgsnapshot-create
   c. qos-create

Added a check to validate string and integer limit and returned
400 if limit exceeds. Also added check to remove leading or trailing
whitespaces and string containing only whitespaces.

APIImpact
1. For all above apis 400 response will be returned.
2. Earlier is was possible to pass only whitespaces or leading-trailing
   spaces to name parameter. Now it will raise 400 error if
   only whitespaces are passed or remove leading-trailing spaces
   from name.

Closes-Bug: 1466351
Closes-Bug: 1463379
Closes-Bug: 1465967
Change-Id: I0c0029d61ba2b293b579d1afffec0bdf062b22a8

1. If you pass name or description parameters with more than
   255 characters to the below apis, then it returns
   500 error code.
   a. consisgroup-create
   b. consisgroup-update
   c. cgsnapshot-create
   d. quota-class-update
   e. quota-update
   f. qos-create
   g. volume-manage
   h. volume-transfer

2. If you pass 'hard_limit' value above mysql INT type to below
   apis, then it returns 500 error code.
   a. quota-class-update
   b. quota-update
   c. encryption-type-create

3. Below apis accept string with whitespaces,
   a. consisgroup-create
   b. cgsnapshot-create
   c. qos-create
   d. volume-transfer

4. If you pass key or value with more than 255 characters to
   type-key api, then it returns 500 error code.

Added a check to validate string and integer limit and returned
400 if it exceeds the limit. Also added check to remove leading or trailing
whitespaces and string containing only whitespaces.

APIImpact
1. For all above apis 400 response will be returned.
2. Earlier it was possible to pass only whitespaces or leading-trailing
   spaces to 'name' parameter or 'key' while updating key-value in type-key api.
   Now it will raise 400 error if only whitespaces are passed and will remove
   leading-trailing spaces if present in other cases.

Closes-Bug: 1466351
Closes-Bug: 1463379

"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2015-07-14 13:35:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/479fee2ab23dec0eb5010d11e24b00050dc002e5', 'message': "Validate string, integer limit for input parameter

1. Below apis will return 500 error code on passing name or description
   parameters with more than 255 characters:
   a. consisgroup-create
   b. consisgroup-update
   c. cgsnapshot-create
   d. quota-class-update
   e. quota-update
   f. qos-create
   g. volume-manage
   h. volume-transfer

2. Below apis will return 500 error code on passing 'hard_limit' value
   greater than mysql INT type:
   a. quota-class-update
   b. quota-update
   c. encryption-type-create

3. Below apis accept name as string with whitespaces:
   a. consisgroup-create
   b. cgsnapshot-create
   c. qos-create
   d. volume-transfer

4. Type-key api will return 500 error code on passing key or value with
   more than 255 characters.

Added a check to validate string and integer limit and returned
400 if it exceeds the limit. Also added check to remove leading or
trailing whitespaces and string containing only whitespaces.

APIImpact
1. For all above apis 400 response will be returned.
2. Earlier it was possible to pass only whitespaces or leading-trailing
   spaces to 'name' parameters and 'key' while updating key-value in
   type-key api.
   Now it will raise 400 error if only whitespaces are passed and will
   remove leading-trailing spaces if present in other cases.

Closes-Bug: 1466351
Closes-Bug: 1463379
Closes-Bug: 1465967
Change-Id: I0c0029d61ba2b293b579d1afffec0bdf062b22a8

commit_message:
Validate string, integer limit for input parameter

1. Below apis will return 500 error code on passing name or description
   parameters with more than 255 characters:
   a. consisgroup-create
   b. consisgroup-update
   c. cgsnapshot-create
   d. quota-class-update
   e. quota-update
   f. qos-create
   g. volume-manage
   h. volume-transfer

2. Below apis will return 500 error code on passing 'hard_limit' value
   greater than mysql INT type:
   a. quota-class-update
   b. quota-update
   c. encryption-type-create

3. Below apis accept name as string with whitespaces:
   a. consisgroup-create
   b. cgsnapshot-create
   c. qos-create
   d. volume-transfer

4. Type-key api will return 500 error code on passing key or value with
   more than 255 characters.

Added new method
1. validate_name_and_description() in
   cinder.api.openstack.wsgi.Controller to validate length of name and
   description and returned 400 if it exceeds the limit and removing
   leading or trailing whitespaces and string containing only
   whitespaces.
2. validate_string_length() in cinder.api.openstack.wsgi.Controller to
   validate length of string and returned 400 if it exceeds the limit.
3. validate_integer() method in cinder.utils to validate integer
   limit and returned 400 if limit exceeds.

APIImpact
1. For all above apis 400 response will be returned.
2. Earlier it was possible to pass only whitespaces or leading-trailing
   spaces to 'name' parameters and 'key' while updating key-value in
   type-key api.
   Now it will raise 400 error if only whitespaces are passed and will
   remove leading-trailing spaces if present in other cases.

Closes-Bug: 1466351
Closes-Bug: 1463379
Closes-Bug: 1465967
Change-Id: I0c0029d61ba2b293b579d1afffec0bdf062b22a8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/68/194968/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def validate_integer(value, name, min_value=None, max_value=None): """Make sure that value is a valid integer, potentially within range. :param value: the value of the integer :param name: the name of the integer :param min_length: the min_length of the integer :param max_length: the max_length of the integer :returns: integer """ try: value = int(str(value)) except (ValueError, UnicodeEncodeError): raise exception.InvalidInput(reason=( _('%s must be an integer') % name)) if min_value is not None and value < min_value: raise exception.InvalidInput( reason=(_('%(value_name)s must be >= %(min_value)d') % {'value_name': name, 'min_value': min_value})) if max_value is not None and value > max_value: raise exception.InvalidInput( reason=(_('%(value_name)s must be <= %(max_value)d') % {'value_name': name, 'max_value': max_value})) return value

Enable merge commits for fuel-plugin-influxdb-grafana-release group

The fuel-plugin-influxdb-grafana project is using feature branches and
needs to be able to upload merge commits for review.

commit_message:
Remove rally-jobs job group

This job group is not really needed, in nearly all cases a single job of
the group is needed and never the whole group.

Instead add to each repository the single job that is used.

Exception: rally itself uses most of the job group, add all used jobs to
it.

This change is just a cleanup, it should not have any side effects on
which jobs run.
It reduces the number of created Jenkins jobs from 6521 to 6464 since
many unused jobs are not generated anymore.

Change-Id: I0a309aa975dccefbcc111c28a12aad9872681dcb

the extensions are enabled by default now, so we no longer need
to specify them in the functional job.

commit_message:
Create an os-testr venv for running subunit2html

This commit creates a venv for installing os-testr which will enable
all test jobs to have access to the subunit2html utility which has
been moved to live inside the os-testr package instead of as a slave
script.

Change-Id: I2050b54eb2def10438764f3eeb55ecf9caa874dc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/38/213238/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Create a virtualenv for os-testr (which contains subunit2html) # this is in /usr instead of /usr/loca/ due to this bug on precise: # https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/python2.7/+bug/839588 sudo -H virtualenv /usr/os-testr-env sudo -H /usr/os-testr-env/bin/pip install os-testr

subject: Change functional testing to use clouds.yaml
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-12 15:54:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/shade/commit/336d958d0f63cced51045c0b387ab463fb3733fe', 'message': 'Change functional testing to use clouds.yaml

Using clouds.yaml, instead of sourcing openrc, we can have better
functional testing by distinquishing between an admin account
and a normal user account.

We cannot both source openrc AND use clouds.yaml as this confuses
the inventory functional tests, and is not a recommended way of
utilizing o-c-c, anyway.

Depends-On: I6458969b45f5534e1172b9f8ba598d7c536a59b5
Change-Id: If459afba3cf61b3c7f641c79494cd53a682666a4
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-13 01:54:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/shade/commit/f05d1b92b2f7000e033dbc9e0c8c74e3776310dc', 'message': 'Change functional testing to use clouds.yaml

Using clouds.yaml, instead of sourcing openrc, we can have better
functional testing by distinquishing between an admin account
and a normal user account.

We cannot both source openrc AND use clouds.yaml as this confuses
the inventory functional tests, and is not a recommended way of

commit_message:
Change functional testing to use clouds.yaml

Using clouds.yaml, instead of sourcing openrc, we can have better
functional testing by distinquishing between an admin account
and a normal user account.

We cannot both source openrc AND use clouds.yaml as this confuses
the inventory functional tests, and is not a recommended way of
utilizing o-c-c, anyway.

In order for these test to work, a bug fix was needed in
os-client-config, so the requirements was bumped to 1.6.2
or higher.

Depends-On: I6458969b45f5534e1172b9f8ba598d7c536a59b5
Change-Id: If459afba3cf61b3c7f641c79494cd53a682666a4

commit_message:
Horizon linting should be voting

Now that horizon JS linting issues are resolved, it is time to make it voting.
This patch remove the lines that make this job non-voting.

Change-Id: Ic31e6b8c197f98ae9533d50c6361b5ff6f8121f9

commit_message:
Drop these config switches as they are no longer being used

The project-config job using these switches is being dropped,
and since the referenced bugs look to be addressed, we can
clean up these as well.

Change-Id: I00d99c05328268b33c6f20b1d24e7507afccb92c
Depends-on: I886f64a2379a8e16957e6ca4bcf784cb22ad2c28

commit_message:
Use the JP Style Guide for KeyStone Service

Splits the keystone.service.js into multiple files
as based off the functions they provide.

Change-Id: I5257be5c246a5fae588d1ed808f0415856da6abd
Implements: blueprint john-papa-style-guide

describe("serviceCatalog", function() { var factory, q, keystoneAPI, userSession, deferred; beforeEach(module('horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api')); beforeEach(module(function($provide) { keystoneAPI = {serviceCatalog: angular.noop}; $provide.value('horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api.keystone', keystoneAPI); userSession = {get: angular.noop}; $provide.value('horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api.userSession', userSession); deferred = {promise: angular.noop, reject: angular.noop, resolve: angular.noop}; q = {all: function() {return {then: angular.noop};}, defer: function() { return deferred;}}; $provide.value('$q', q); $provide.value('$cacheFactory', function() { return 'cache'; }); })); beforeEach(inject(['horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api.serviceCatalog', function(serviceCatalog) { factory = serviceCatalog; }])); it('defines the factory', function() { expect(factory).toBeDefined(); }); it('defines .cache', function() { expect(factory.cache).toBe("cache"); }); it('defines .get', function() { expect(factory.get).toBeDefined(); }); describe(".get() features", function() { var postAction = {then: angular.noop}; beforeEach(function() { spyOn(keystoneAPI, 'serviceCatalog').and.returnValue(postAction); spyOn(postAction, 'then'); factory.get(); }); it("gets the service catalog", function() { expect(keystoneAPI.serviceCatalog).toHaveBeenCalled(); }); it("then returns the response's data member", function() { var func = postAction.then.calls.argsFor(0)[0]; expect(func({data: 'thing'})).toBe("thing"); }); }); it('defines .ifTypeEnabled', function() { expect(factory.ifTypeEnabled).toBeDefined(); }); describe(".ifTypeEnabled features", function() { var postAction = {then: angular.noop}; beforeEach(function() { spyOn(q, 'all').and.returnValue(postAction); spyOn(factory, 'get'); spyOn(postAction, 'then'); spyOn(deferred, 'reject'); spyOn(deferred, 'resolve'); }); var callMethod = function(type, data, resolved) { factory.ifTypeEnabled(type); expect(q.all).toHaveBeenCalled(); var successFunc = postAction.then.calls.argsFor(0)[0]; var failFunc = postAction.then.calls.argsFor(0)[1]; successFunc(data); // If we expected this to be resolved, then expect // both that we did call resolve() and did NOT call reject(). // Vice versa if expecting rejection. if (resolved) { expect(deferred.resolve).toHaveBeenCalled(); expect(deferred.reject).not.toHaveBeenCalled(); } else { expect(deferred.resolve).not.toHaveBeenCalled(); expect(deferred.reject).toHaveBeenCalled(); } deferred.reject.calls.reset(); failFunc(); expect(deferred.reject).toHaveBeenCalled(); }; it("accepts 'desired' type with no matches; is rejected", function() { var data = {catalog: [1, 2, 3], session: {services_region: true}}; callMethod("desired", data, false); }); it("accepts 'desired' type with matches but no endpoints; is rejected", function() { var data = {catalog: [1, {type: "desired", endpoints: []}, 3], session: {services_region: true}}; callMethod("desired", data, false); }); it("accepts 'desired' type with a match; is resolved", function() { var data = {catalog: [{type: "desired", endpoints: [{region_id: true}]}], session: {services_region: true}}; callMethod("desired", data, true); }); it("accepts 'desired' type with matches and region is true; is resolved", function() { var data = {catalog: [{type: "desired", endpoints: [{region: true}]}], session: {services_region: true}}; callMethod("desired", data, true); }); it("accepts 'desired' type with matches and service_region is true; is resolved", function() { var data = {catalog: [{type: "identity"}], session: {services_region: true}}; callMethod("identity", data, true); }); }); }); })();

in kilo stable branch.

Also this commit adds functional tests in v2.1 and merge unit tests
between v2 and v2.1

Closes-Bug: 1470690

commit_message:
Fix 'OS-EXT-VIF-NET' extension missing in v2.1 -Kilo

V2 API has extension for virtual interface 'OS-EXT-VIF-NET'
but it is not present in v2.1 API. Because of this there is
difference between v2 and v2.1 response of virtual interface API.

v2 List virtual interface Response (with all extension enable)
{
    "virtual_interfaces": [
        {
            "id": "%(id)s",
            "mac_address": "%(mac_addr)s",
            "OS-EXT-VIF-NET:net_id": "%(id)s"
        }
    ]
}

v2.1 List virtual interface Response
{
    "virtual_interfaces": [
        {
            "id": "%(id)s",
            "mac_address": "%(mac_addr)s"
        }
    ]
}

Attribute  "OS-EXT-VIF-NET:net_id" is missing in v2.1

This was somehow missed during the v2.1 implementation because
there was no functional tests for virtual interface API in v2.1.
This was found during merging of functional tests between
v2 and v2.1 - I7097483cb57ed785b01fddb4f832e453f71987fd

As v2.1 APIs are released in Kilo, this commits fix this issue
in kilo stable branch.

Fix in master branch - I289f21f9e42fff95d8ea68fbaefc9bec166b9540

Also this commit adds functional tests in v2.1 and merge unit tests
between v2 and v2.1

Change-Id: I7939bf1b63c98eb17bc8bdc4711f56c81f4da08d
Closes-Bug: 1470690
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/50/197850/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "mac_address": "%(mac_addr)s", "OS-EXT-VIF-NET:net_id": "%(id)s"}

}

{

            "mac_address": "%(mac_addr)s"
        }
    ]
}

Attribute  "OS-EXT-VIF-NET:net_id" is missing in v2.1
This was somehow missed during the v2.1 implementation because
there was no functional tests for virtual interface API in v2.1.

This was found during merging of functional tests between
v2 and v2.1 - I7097483cb57ed785b01fddb4f832e453f71987fd

This commits fix the v2.1 to have same response as v2 virtual interface
API with 'OS-EXT-VIF-NET' extension enabled.

Also this commit fix functional tests and unit tests to run the same tests
against v2 and v2.1

Change-Id: I289f21f9e42fff95d8ea68fbaefc9bec166b9540

commit_message:
Fix 'OS-EXT-VIF-NET' extension missing in v2.1

V2 API has extension for virtual interface 'OS-EXT-VIF-NET'
but it is not present in v2.1 API. Because of this there is
difference between v2 and v2.1 response of virtual interface API.

v2 List virtual interface Response (with all extension enable)

{
    "virtual_interfaces": [
        {
            "id": "%(id)s",
            "mac_address": "%(mac_addr)s",
            "OS-EXT-VIF-NET:net_id": "%(id)s"
        }
    ]
}

v2.1 List virtual interface Response

{
    "virtual_interfaces": [
        {
            "id": "%(id)s",
            "mac_address": "%(mac_addr)s"
        }
    ]
}

Attribute  "OS-EXT-VIF-NET:net_id" is missing in v2.1
This was somehow missed during the v2.1 implementation because
there was no functional tests for virtual interface API in v2.1.

This was found during merging of functional tests between
v2 and v2.1 - I7097483cb57ed785b01fddb4f832e453f71987fd

This commits fix the v2.1 to have same response as v2 virtual interface
API with 'OS-EXT-VIF-NET' extension enabled.

Also this commit fix functional tests and unit tests to run the same tests
against v2 and v2.1

Change-Id: I289f21f9e42fff95d8ea68fbaefc9bec166b9540
Closes-Bug: 1470690

commit_message:
Puppet-dashboard is read only now

This software hasn't been used for some time and its original upstream
has been dead for a while. Puppetborad largely replaced this. Let it
rest in peace.

Depends-On: I530a738519621566a92937459fd44e845c6bfb11

(the removal of the puppet-dashboard code)

Change-Id: I2dfb4d568997cd5134c16ef6e53a0ba1ac78a7ef

commit_message:
libvirt: use instance UUID with exception InstanceNotFound

Ensure that the UUID is used when using the exception. A instance
name is not unique.

Note: This is follow-up of commit 8845b6558af7764b6bfcdf092b64c285ff3716c2,
make sure we fix that in all places.

Change-Id: I9355024cdd95a78968e2acea3278c5d492902c64

commit_message:
Register alembic_migrations at install time

This allows neutron-db-manage to find the alembic migrations
automatically if this project is installed.

The config file alembic.ini is not needed in this project since it's
tables are in neutron's DB and so it depends on neutron's config.

Remove the l2gw-db-manage script since we will use
neutron-db-manage.

Update the alembic env to know about all neutron core tables when
generating diffs for --autogenerate.

Partial-Bug: #1470625

Depends-On: I9a06de64ce35675af28adf819de6f22dc832390d

Change-Id: I581932d333e378d91d5b581760018ec274330681

commit_message:
Removing refrence to bind_requested flag

During Ironic mid-cycle, we decided that this
flag is not needed. Instead, we will use host-id
for this purpose. When the port does not
need to be bound, host-id will be set to None.
Neutron (ML2 plugin) already has a mechanism to
deal with this. Therefore, it was decided that
we do not need two ways to accomplish one action.

Change-Id: I7936fd7545a4672042b32e1c941798f7b5dd1272

commit_message:
Minimal setuptools required for tests

pkg_resources.RequirementParseError has been introduced in
setuptools 16.0. That's the minimal version for running tests.

Change-Id: I4ee2d60a48b4b783d65a7516d794c69c86e4c334

commit_message:
Remove Sqlite validation for database_connection

Remove unneeded validation of database_connection for Sqlite,
because it is under case of unsupported db backend.

Change-Id: Id10bd0b598c350330fd4179c7311a900c4854b59

deleted_lines: validate_re($database_connection, '(sqlite|mysql|postgresql):\/\/(\S+:\S+@\S+\/\S+)?') /^sqlite:\/\//: { fail('Sahara does not support sqlite!') }

Ordered datasource actions list

Sorts the datasource actions list API result,
list all actions order by action name so that
the users can find out the action easily.

commit_message:
Do refactor for neutronv2 driver

Aims to keep consistence of datasource driver state,
and avoid the conflict between datasource row list and
datasource updating state. Do some refactor for
neutronv2 driver, use a temporary state to collect row data,
then override the self.state table one by one.

This is a demo for getting some feedback from other reviewers.
If the way is approved, same refactor will been implemented on
all other datasource drivers by following the pattern.

Change-Id: I74102f35ca16b82419de145a5263eb5d135e82a3
Partial-Bug: #1473924

commit_message:
Add update_state in DataSourceDriver

Implements common logic about updating state in
DataSourceDriver class, and call it in decorator
@check_raw_data_changed_and_update_state in order
to help the subclass datasource drivers to update
self.state automatically when they use the decorator.

Change-Id: Ib296ad0f32a2cb924e27d036eb0e644e00bfdc16
Partial-Bug: #1473924
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/77/206777/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # All table names that defined in subclass driver. ALL_TABLES = set() # init all tables. self._initialize_tables() def _initialize_tables(self): for table in self.ALL_TABLES: self.state[table] = set() def update_state(self, row_data): tmp_state = {} for table, row in row_data: if table in self.ALL_TABLES: if table not in tmp_state: tmp_state[table] = set() tmp_state[table].add(row) else: LOG.warning('table %s is undefined in ALL_TABLES %s', table, self.ALL_TABLES) for table in tmp_state: self.state[table] = tmp_state[table]

commit_message:
Allow stack sudo in nodepool dsvm job

The nodepool job can't build dib images without giving the nodepool
process (running as stack) sudo rights. Go ahead and allow the stack
user to sudo in this job since we don't need to test rootwrap here.

Once this gets in the work to add dib image builds in the dsvm test
can proceed.

Change-Id: I304ac3732eb57723e5bfc584cc1e3a2e5a0667ab

commit_message:
Bump version of bandit to 0.13.2

The latest version of bandit 0.13.2 includes many fixes over the
previous 0.10.1.  This will help many projects that are currently
using bandit and possibly reduce some configuration issues with
their bandit.yaml.

Change-Id: I5f51cd5c9832e5efb46fd08f937051e1efb80557

subject: Bump pecan to 1.0.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-14 10:57:19.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/1b55722017deebb81b16f297564318ff8e197e9c', 'message': "Bump pecan to 1.0.0

Neutron is introducing a Pecan WSGI server. However, its URIs
have segments which, despite being compliant with RFC 3986 cannot
be handled by pecan 0.8 as they're not valid python identifiers
names.

This patch proposes a bump to 1.0 in order to ensure that all
valid characters for RFC 3986 can be specfied in pecan route
segments.

Note: both ubuntu (vivid) and fedora (23) do not package pecan 1.0.
However, this is true also for several openstack libraries, and
being pecan a former stackforge project the same exception
made for libraries such as oslo-db might apply to Pecan as well.

Change-Id: I858b54c8fbc7037d11fd58846a817d955ed2c5f8
"}]
commit_message:
Bump pecan to 1.0.0

Neutron is introducing a Pecan WSGI server. However, its URIs
have segments which, despite being compliant with RFC 3986 cannot
be handled by pecan 0.8 as they're not valid python identifiers
names.

This patch proposes a bump to 1.0 in order to ensure that all
valid characters for RFC 3986 can be specfied in pecan route
segments.

Note: both ubuntu (vivid) and fedora (23) do not package pecan 1.0.
However, this is true also for several openstack libraries, and
being pecan a former stackforge project the same exception
made for libraries such as oslo-db might apply to Pecan as well.

Change-Id: I858b54c8fbc7037d11fd58846a817d955ed2c5f8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/85/213085/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pecan>=1.0.0

commit_message:
Bumg python-manilaclient version to 1.2.0

Manilaclient of versions below 1.2.0 uses already removed old
'oslo' namespace and does not work because of it. So, bump it to lowest
version that uses new namespaces.

Change-Id: I971a82c45f90e490190553f681d5c61ba924924e

commit_message:
Bump gabbi to version 1.1.4

Ceilometer has used gabbi, but version 0.12.0 cannot support build tests
with prefix. build_tests() method didn't has prefix parameter in
version 0.12.0, see [1]

[1] https://github.com/cdent/gabbi/blob/master/gabbi/driver.py#L62

Change-Id: I4103d15f8c350fe4a9e3e3c0f74de160dc94426e

commit_message:
Correct the files's description "overrwriter"

The parameter of method create files's description contains incorrect word.

Modify "overrwrite" to "overwrite".

Closes-Bug: #1482081

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-19 20:09:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/56c068c2a4debf40e00779de9ee4bec67e951a28', 'message': 'Preserve DVR FIP rule priority over Agent restarts

IP rule priorities assigned to DVR floating IPs need
to be preserved over L3 agent restarts. Such a
 mechanism is already in place for Link Local IP
address allocation.

This change generalizes the allocation management
mechanism used for managing Link Local IP addresses
and utilizes it for managing floating ip rule priorities.

The ItemAllocator class is used as base clase for the
classes LinkLocalAllocator and FipRulePriorityAllocator
which in turn provide the allocator objects for each
use case.

Change-Id: I6a75aa8ad612ee80b391f0a27a8a7e29519c3f8d

commit_message:
Preserve DVR FIP rule priority over Agent restarts

IP rule priorities assigned to DVR floating IPs need
to be preserved over L3 agent restarts. Reuse
the ItemAllocator class decomposed from Link Local IP
address allocation.  Also move commn unit tests to
ItemAllocator class.

Closes-Bug: #1414779
Change-Id: I6a75aa8ad612ee80b391f0a27a8a7e29519c3f8d
Co-Authored-By: Rajeev Grover <rajeev.grover@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/11/193711/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
class TestItemAllocator(base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestItemAllocator, self).setUp() def test__init__(self): test_pool = set(lla.FipPriority(s) for s in range(32768, 40000)) a = lla.ItemlAllocator('/file', lla.LinkLocalAddressPair, test_pool) self.assertEqual('/file', a.state_file) self.assertEqual({}, a.allocations) self.assertEqual(lla.LinkLocalAddressPair, a.ItemClass) self.assertEqual(test_pool, a.pool) class TestFipPriority(base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestFipPriority, self).setUp() def test__init__(self): test_pr = lla.FipPriority(10) self.assertEqual(10, test_pr.index) def test__repr__(self): test_pr = lla.FipPriority(20) self.assertEqual("20", str(test_pr)) def test__eq__(self): left_pr = lla.FipPriority(10) right_pr = lla.FipPriority(10) other_pr = lla.FipPriority(20) self.assertEqual(left_pr, right_pr) self.assertNotEqual(left_pr, other_pr) self.assertNotEqual(right_pr, other_pr) def test__hash__(self): left_pr = lla.FipPriority(10) right_pr = lla.FipPriority(10) other_pr = lla.FipPriority(20) self.assertEqual(hash(left_pr), hash(right_pr)) self.assertNotEqual(hash(left_pr), hash(other_pr)) self.assertNotEqual(hash(other_pr), hash(right_pr)) def test_set_operations(self): starting_set = set(lla.FipPriority(str(s)) for s in range(1, 10)) remove_priority_list = [lla.FipPriority('8'), lla.FipPriority('9')] starting_set.difference_update(remove_priority_list) self.assertNotIn(lla.FipPriority('8'), starting_set) self.assertNotIn(remove_priority_list, starting_set) class TestFipRulePriorityAllocator(base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestFipRulePriorityAllocator, self).setUp() self.priority_rule_start = 100 self.priority_rule_end = 200 self.data_store_path = '/data_store_path_test' def test__init__(self): frpa = lla.FipRulePriorityAllocator(self.data_store_path, self.priority_rule_start, self.priority_rule_end) self.assertEqual(self.data_store_path, frpa.state_file) self.assertEqual(lla.FipPriority, frpa.ItemClass) self.assertEqual(self.priority_rule_end - self.priority_rule_start, len(frpa.pool)) def test_allocate(self): frpa = lla.FipRulePriorityAllocator(self.data_store_path, self.priority_rule_start, self.priority_rule_end) with mock.patch.object(lla.FipRulePriorityAllocator, '_write') as write: allocated_priority = frpa.allocate("101.0.0.1") write.assert_called_once_with(['101.0.0.1,%s
' % allocated_priority]) self.assertNotIn(allocated_priority, frpa.pool) self.assertIn("101.0.0.1", frpa.allocations) def test_allocate_from_file(self): expected_priority = lla.FipPriority('102') with mock.patch.object(lla.FipRulePriorityAllocator, '_read') as read: read.return_value = ["101.0.0.2,102
"] frpa = lla.FipRulePriorityAllocator(self.data_store_path, self.priority_rule_start, self.priority_rule_end) with mock.patch.object(lla.FipRulePriorityAllocator, '_write') as write: allocated_priority = frpa.allocate("101.0.0.2") self.assertFalse(write.called) self.assertIsInstance(allocated_priority, lla.FipPriority) self.assertEqual(str(expected_priority), str(allocated_priority)) self.assertNotIn(expected_priority, frpa.pool) self.assertIn("101.0.0.2", frpa.allocations) self.assertEqual(str(frpa.allocations['101.0.0.2']), str(expected_priority)) def test_allocate_exhausted_pool(self): test_priority = lla.FipPriority('100') with mock.patch.object(lla.FipRulePriorityAllocator, '_read') as read: read.return_value = ["101.0.0.1,100
"] frpa = lla.FipRulePriorityAllocator(self.data_store_path, 100, 101) self.assertNotIn(test_priority, frpa.pool) with mock.patch.object(lla.FipRulePriorityAllocator, '_write') as write: allocated_priority = frpa.allocate("101.0.0.2") write.assert_called_once_with(['101.0.0.2,%s
' % allocated_priority]) self.assertIn("101.0.0.2", frpa.allocations) self.assertEqual(test_priority, frpa.allocations["101.0.0.2"]) self.assertNotIn("101.0.0.1", frpa.allocations) self.assertNotIn(allocated_priority, frpa.pool) def test_release(self): with mock.patch.object(lla.FipRulePriorityAllocator, '_write') as write: frpa = lla.FipRulePriorityAllocator(self.data_store_path, self.priority_rule_start, self.priority_rule_end) allocated_priority = frpa.allocate("102.0.0.1") self.assertIn("102.0.0.1", frpa.allocations) write.assert_called_once_with(['102.0.0.1,%s
' % allocated_priority]) self.assertNotIn(allocated_priority, frpa.pool) write.reset_mock() frpa.release("102.0.0.1") self.assertNotIn("102.0.0.1", frpa.allocations) self.assertIn(allocated_priority, frpa.pool) write.assert_called_once_with([])

commit_message:
Tacker API extension for NFV MANO

This specification describes the new 'vnfm' extension that will be added
to Tacker v1 REST API based on ETSI NFV MANO standards.

Change-Id: I1fc345df2ce7d67c83bda6e2ed3fe5d6c5049f35
Blueprint: tacker-api-mano
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker-specs refs/changes/26/204926/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Implement Tacker API v1 based on NFV MANO ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tacker/+spec/tacker-api-mano This spec describes the plan to move Tacker REST API endpoints from servicevm standards to ETSI defined NFV MANO standards [1] Problem description =================== Tacker service currently implements REST API end points based on servicevm standards. However, the Tacker service is built on principles of the VNF Manager as described in the ETSI NFV MANO architecture [1]. Hence, it is necessary to expose REST API end points for VNF resources and describe them accordingly. Proposed change =============== The actual task of moving Tacker from servicevm to NFV MANO standards in entirety is complex and hence will be done in phases. The proposed changes involve the following action items: * Add new REST API entry points to describe VNF resources. * Modify plugin and database backend implementation to move from servicevm to NFV MANO standards. * Move out of home grown REST framework and implement the Pecan framework to describe and implement CRUD operations on VNF resources. As part of this specification, new entry points based on NFV MANO standards will be integrated to Tacker. The VNF resources will be described as a new REST API extension to Tacker and integrated to v1. The current implementation of servicevm based endpoints will be retained for backward compatibility. Alternatives ------------ Other solution is to integrate the Pecan framework in to Tacker. This involves refactoring the entire project in one phase to update to NFV MANO stanadards. Currently, tacker is based on stable Kilo release branch and does not support Pecan framework. This solution can only be implemented when Tacker moves to master release for OpenStack services. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- New extension 'nfv' will be introduced in v1 which will implement REST API end points as described below: **/vnfd** :: +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ |Attribute |Type |Access |Default |Validation/ |Description | |Name | | |Value |Con^ersion | | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ |id |string |RO, All |generated |N/A |identity | | |(UUID) | | | | | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ |name |string |RW, All |'' |string |human+readable | | | | | | |name | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ |description |string |RW, All |'' |string |description of | | | | | | |template | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ |attributes |dict |RW, All |None |dict |TOSCA YAML file | | | | | | | | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ |infra_driver |string |RW, All |heat |string |driver to provision | | | | | | |VNF | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ |mgmt_driver |string |RW All |noop |string |driver to configure | | | | | | |VNF | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ |service_types |string |RW, All |'' |list |NFV service type | | | | | | |(VNF, NSD) | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ |tenant_id |string |RO, All |N/A |string |project id to | | | | | | |launch VNF | +--------------+-------+--------+----------+---------------------------------+ **/vnf** :: +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ |Attribute |Type |Access |Default |Validation/ |Description | |Name | | |Value |Con^ersion | | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ |id |string |RO, All |generated |N/A |identity | | |(UUID) | | | | | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ |name |string |RW, All |'' |string |human+readable | | | | | | |name | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ |description |string |RW, All |'' |string |description of | | | | | | |template | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ |attributes |dict |RW, All |None |dict |TOSCA YAML file | | | | | | | | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ |instance_id |string |RO, All |generated |string |identity of | | | | | | |VM instance | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ |mgmt_url |string |RO, All |None |string |IP address of | | | | | | |VNF management net. | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ |tenant_id |string |RW, All |generated |string |project id to | | | | | | |launch VNF | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ |template_id |string |RW, All |generated |string |VNFD id | | | | | | | | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ |status |string |RO, All |generated |string |current state | | | | | | |of VNF | +--------------+-------+--------+----------+---------------------------------+ Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- There will be no direct impact on python-tackerclient with the way the user will interact with the client. However, python-tackerclient will be modified to send API requests to VNF resources instead of servicevm resource requests which is the current implementation. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: sseetha Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- 1. Add new extension 'nfv' to tacker v1 and update the resource attribute map. 2. The extension should internally call servicevm plugin base. 3. Modify API requests from tackerclient to reflect VNF resources in requests body. 4. Add new unit tests for the extension. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= As of now, there are no tempest tests added to Tacker and will be tracked as a separate activity. Documentation Impact ==================== A documentation page capturing the new REST API VNF v1 resources will be added in Tacker wiki link [2]. References ========== [1] http://www.ietf.org/proceedings/88/slides/slides-88-opsawg-6.pdf [2] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Tacker/API

commit_message:
Neutron base does not need python-neutron-client package

There is no such package.  It is called python-neutronclient.

Since we know deployments work well without this dependency,
might as well just remove the error since it pops up in the
gating.

Change-Id: Ic0daf85201cf283ee0560a9905e5079e421efbc4
Partially-Implements: blueprint gate-source-builds

The openvswich package is only available in the rdo repositories.

commit_message:
NSX plugin: Moving away plugin extensions

As part of plugin decomposition, this patch moves vmware-nsx extensions
out of the neutron repository.

Change-Id: Iff4c4781dd96b10733a98f176cf2f0f4d25cb34f
Related-Blueprint: core-vendor-decomposition
Partial-bug: #1483453

commit_message:
Fix oslo_messaging package name for default log level

Since the oslo namespace was dropped in the oslo.messaging
library, we need to fix the package name as well.

Closes-Bug: #1484501
Change-Id: Ibcc8868dcb39f82421369e212e527449cb0e49c5
(cherry picked from commit b5f32bb0e1bb7d77b8034164359f0be2bbe4b6d9)

commit_message:
Add "port(s)" to "Ports binding ext attr"

This is a bug similar to https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-api-site/+bug/1480312,
which has been confirmed.  A patch for the bug has already been merged.

"Request parameters" and "Response parameters" tables of "Ports
binding extended attributes" are missing "port(s)" (xsd:dict). Please
see http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-networking-v2-ext.html#port_binding-ext .

I also did some refactoring on common.ent to make it more maintenance
friendly.

(DF): Ran spell-check on common.ent and did more clean-up.

Change-Id: I7986945eea6b98b7fb26d32a275ef6a5635c14b7
Closes-Bug: #1482245

commit_message:
use union all when building trait query

union all is more performant as it doesn't need to filter out
duplicates. we should not have duplicates as the primary key
conditions already ensure that.

Change-Id: Ic25f7086b33a98ca77a669732a65be5a95b7f0db

"""WSGI script for Nova metadata EXPERIMENTAL support script for running Nova metadata under Apache2 etc. """ from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging from paste import deploy from nova import config from nova import objects from nova import service # noqa from nova import utils CONF = cfg.CONF config_files = ['/etc/nova/api-paste.ini', '/etc/nova/nova.conf'] config.parse_args([], default_config_files=config_files) LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) logging.setup(CONF, "nova") utils.monkey_patch() objects.register_all() conf = config_files[0] name = "metadata" options = deploy.appconfig('config:%s' % conf, name=name) application = deploy.loadapp('config:%s' % conf, name=name)

commit_message:
Remove the iSCSI rescan during disconnect

Doing an iSCSI rescan at disconnect time is pretty
dangerous to do.  iSCSI rescan doesn't make volumes
go away, it makes them show back up.  So during Nova
live migration it will make local scsi volumes show
back up.

Nova live migration first loops over volumes and calls
disconnect_volume, then after that it loops over the volumes
again and call's cinder to terminate_connection.

If disconnect_volume does a rescan, then volumes there were
removed during previous calls will show back up, because cinder's
driver hasn't had a chance to terminate the connection yet
from the array.

Closes-Bug: #1483326
Change-Id: I8708db16a4b9057b09abad9f956fa5a3bb4ba54c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/65/203265/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Moved _rescan_iscsi and _rescan_multipath # from _disconnect_volume_multipath_iscsi to here. # Otherwise, if we do rescan after _linuxscsi.remove_multipath_device # but before logging out, the removed devices under /dev/disk/by-path # will reappear after rescan. self._rescan_iscsi()

commit_message:
Call pypowervm LPAR Wrapper validation on deploy

The additional validation in pypowervm will catch and raise
deployment violations that the PowerVM management interface will raise.
This is done to avoid issuing failing calls to the management interface.

There is still several validation checks needed in pypowervm.
Currently the validation will check that the LPAR desired processors
will not exceed what's available on the host.

Additional validation checks to be implemented in pypowervm:
1. Memory validation
2. Deploy vs resize validation

Change-Id: I3db3ada41e43da52072eaaf4eef3592668e05c8f

commit_message:
Add spec for neutron-external-attachment-points

Adds the specification for the neutron external
attachment points extension to integrate external
devices (e.g. baremetal instances) into a neutron network.

Change-Id: Ieea08993f364415c56e3416b1d222101ce5d1ac9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/25/87825/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =================================================== Physical Port Extension for baremetal compute nodes =================================================== Launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/neutron-baremetal-compute This blueprint is to introduce the concept of physical ports into Neutron via an extension so baremetal workloads can gain access to Neutron networks. Admins will create the physical port resources with the MAC address of the attached device and port identifier information for the backend. Physical ports will then be assigned to tenants, who will be allowed to associate them to physical networks. Problem description =================== There is no well-defined way to connect a device not managed by OpenStack directly into a Neutron network. Even if everything is manually configured to setup connectivity, the neutron DHCP agent will not issue addresses to the device attached to the physical port since it doesn't have a corresponding Neutron port. Proposed change =============== To integrate these baremetal devices into Neutron networks, this blueprint introduces the physical port extension. It will add a new mixin class for plugins to use to handle the database accounting for the physical port methods. Physical ports are created by admins and then assigned to a tenant for use. The tenant can then assign the physical port to any of the Neutron networks that the tenant can create a Neutron port on. When a tenant assigns a physical port to a network, the mixin code will automatically create a Neutron port on that network with the MAC address configured by the admin on the physical port. This will give the DHCP server the necessary information to issue IP addresses to the connected device. This keeps the IP allocation for a subnet fully managed by Neutron and enables the visibility of physical devices from neutron. It also paves the way for integrating Ironic with Neutron. Alternatives ------------ There isn't a very good alternative right now. To attach a physical device to a Neutron network, the admin has to lookup the VLAN (or other segment identifier) for that network and then manually associate a port to that VLAN. The end device then has to be configured with a static IP in an exclusion range on the Neutron subnet. Tenants then cannot assign the physical device to a different network, disable the port, or see any indication that the device is actually attached to the network. Data model impact ----------------- For plugins that leverage this extension, it will add a new physical ports table. This table will contain the following fields: * id - standard object UUID * name - optional name * port_id - nullable foreign-key reference to associated Neutron port * mac_address - MAC address of attached device to use in Neutron port creation * attachment - an arbitrary identifier for the backend to identify the port This will have no impact on the existing data model. REST API impact --------------- The following is the API exposed for physical ports. .. code-block:: python RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP = { 'physical_ports': { 'id': {'allow_post': False, 'allow_put': False, 'enforce_policy': True, 'validate': {'type:uuid': None}, 'is_visible': True, 'primary_key': True}, 'tenant_id': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'required_by_policy': True, 'is_visible': True}, 'network_id': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'enforce_policy': True, 'is_visible': True, 'default': None}, 'port_id': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'enforce_policy': True, 'validate': {'type:uuid_or_none': None}, 'is_visible': True, 'default': None}, 'name': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'enforce_policy': True, 'validate': {'type:string': None}, 'is_visible': True, 'default': ''}, 'description': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'enforce_policy': True, 'validate': {'type:string': None}, 'is_visible': True, 'default': ''}, 'mac_address': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'enforce_policy': True, 'validate': {'type:mac_address': None}, 'required_by_policy': True, 'is_visible': True}, 'attachment': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'enforce_policy': True, 'default': False, 'validate': {'type:string': None}, 'is_visible': True, 'required_by_policy': True} } } The following is the default policy for physical ports. .. code-block:: javascript { "create_physical_port": "rule:admin_only", "get_physical_port": "rule:admin_or_owner", "update_physical_port:tenant_id": "rule:admin_only", "update_physical_port": "rule:admin_or_owner", "delete_physical_port": "rule:admin_only" } Security impact --------------- There should be no security impact to Neutron. However, these ports will not have security groups applied to them so users should be warned of this in the documentation. Notifications impact -------------------- N/A Other end user impact --------------------- The neutron command-line client will be updated with the new physical port CRUD commands. Performance Impact ------------------ None to plugins that don't use this extension. For plugins that use this extension it will be limited since most this code is only called during physical port CRUD operations. Other deployer impact --------------------- N/A Developer impact ---------------- If plugin developers want to use this, they will need to enable the extension and use the mixin module. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: kevinbenton Other contributors: kanzhe-jiang Work Items ---------- * Complete DB mixin model and extension API attributes * Update python neutron client to support the new physical port commands * Implement reference implementation in ML2 Dependencies ============ N/A Testing ======= This may be untestable in tempest by default because it requires physical infrastructure. Documentation Impact ==================== New admin and tenant workflows need to be documented for this extension. It should not impact any other documentation. References ========== N/A
